column2: a small meteorite crashed into a wooded area in nicaragua capital of managua overnight the government said sunday residents reported hearing a mysterious boom that left a deep crater near the city airport the associated press reports which measured 60 feet in diameter skimmed the earth this weekend abc news reports said humberto saballos a volcanologist with the nicaraguan institute of territorial studies who was on the committee he said it is still not clear if the meteorite disintegrated or was buried of the astronomy center at the national autonomous university of nicaragua said the meteorite could be related to an asteroid that was forecast to pass by the planet saturday night he said an adviser to the institute of territorial studies said it was very strange that no one reported a streak of light we have to ask if anyone has a photo or something but said they did see anything strange in the sky then all of a sudden i heard a large blast we thought it was a bomb because we felt an expansive wave jorge santamaria told the associated press

last week we hinted at what was to come as ebola fears spread across america today we get confirmation as the daily caller reports one passenger at dulles international airport outside washington is apparently not taking any chances a female passenger dressed in a hazmat suit complete with a full body gown mask and gloves was spotted wednesday waiting for a flight at the airport try halloween stores if you need a suit in a hurry

newser wonder how long a quarter pounder with cheese can last two australians say they bought a few mcdonald burgers for friends back in 1995 when they were teens and one of the friends never showed up so the kid burger went stayed that way australia news network reports pretty sure the oldest burger in the world says one of the men casey dean holding onto the burger for their friend started off as a joke he adds but the months became years and now 20 years later it looks the same as it did the day we bought it perfectly preserved in its original wrapping eduard nitz even took the burger on australian tv show the project last night and showed off the specimen news 9 reports the pair offered to take a bite of it for charity but were dissuaded by the show hosts they also started a facebook page for the burger called can this 20 year old burger get more likes than kanye west that has more than 4044 likes as of this writing and they selling an itunes song free the burger for and giving proceeds to the charity beyond blue which helps australians battle anxiety and depression a few years ago a man sold a bottle of mcdonald mcjordan sauce for 10000 here why mickey d food seemingly never decays

at least 25 suspected boko haram insurgents were killed in clashes between soldiers and the islamist militants in northeast nigeria and five civilians were killed in fighting elsewhere in the region a military source and residents said on monday and talks were due to continue in neighbouring chad on monday who requested anonymity said the militants tried to enter the town of damboa late on sunday through alagarno a boko haram hideout but soldiers fought them off men gunned down 25 of the insurgents because they would have entered damboa and unleashed more terror on the town that is just picking up from its the officer said a garrison town near the border with cameroon has been the site of fierce fighting between the militants and nigerian forces for months the insurgents sacked the town in july but were driven out by an army mohammed haruna said of clashes on sunday of our members came to the town of biu this morning from damboa and said the soldiers engaged boko haram yesterday and the battle lasted till about maiduguri resident andrew tada said the insurgents killed five people in gava a hilly town in gwoza local government area not far from damboa women and he told reuters after speaking with his brother on the phone they pursued them and slaughtered tada said

cnn a meteorite crashed down in managua nicaragua late saturday night causing a loud explosion and leaving a crater 39 feet 12 meters across government officials said according to the associated press no damage or injuries were reported called 2014 rc was expected to pass safely above the earth on sunday nasa said at a distance of about 25000 miles 40000 kilometers just the distance from the center of earth to the moon it was estimated to be 60 feet 18 meters long and nicaragua is asking the united states to help investigate the event jose millan with the nicaraguan institute of earth studies was quoted as saying on the today nicaragua website the lack of fireball reports from the surrounding populated area seems to suggest some other cause cooke wrote in a nasa blog post and an object capable of producing a crater this large would have also generated a very bright fireball brighter than the full moon that should have been seen over a wide area 000 feet 300 meters from the camino real hotel but experts say none of the ones being tracked is expected to hit the planet anytime soon though space rocks sneak by the scientists and amateur astronomers who track them on february 15 2013 a nearly meteor plunged into earth atmosphere and exploded over the russian city of chelyabinsk with the force of about 30 nuclear bombs the blast injured about 1500 people one that was being carefully tracked by nasa safely passed by earth astronauts will land on the asteroid take samples and bring them back to earth

move over netflix and hulu which could give rivals a run for their money the online retail giant is planning to roll out the new service early next year the new york post reported on friday it would be separate from amazon 99 yearly prime membership which offers unlimited movie streaming from the instant video library an amazon spokeswoman neither confirmed nor denied the rumor and there are display ads on some short videos such as movie and game trailers the spokeswoman said we often experimenting with new offers and experiences for customers but we have not announced any plans to offer an video streaming service of course amazon however quickly shot down that rumor but we have no plans to offer a free service an amazon spokesperson said at the time the report suggests that it might not be free one source speculated that amazon may undercut netflix current monthly price of though or to get to a broader audience that does want to pay for prime in order to increase their video share a source told the news outlet amazon is already gaining ground on streaming rivals a recent sandvine study found that amazon instant video has established itself as the second largest paid streaming video service in north america though netflix still dominates but its share has more than doubled in the past 18 months sandvine said amazon is also mulling its own travel service which would let you book stays at independent hotels and resorts according to a report from travel news site skift the amazon travel site set to launch around 1 would reportedly feature a curated selection of hotels within a few hours drive from new york los angeles and seattle check out 16 tips every amazon addict should know in the slideshow above as well as 60 geeky movies tv shows on amazon you should stream now meanwhile have a new way to access content the amazon fire tv stick at amazon is now shipping be sure to check out pcmag review and the video below

an article saying nasa confirmed six days of in december is fake and merely an iteration of an old internet hoax bogus rumors saying that there will be three days of darkness in december but obviously proven not to be true a and entertainment website posted an article about six days of darkness it uses fake quotes from a nasa official during these three days without sunlight due to a solar storm which will cause dust and space debris to become plentiful and thus block 90 it reads in part the about us section reads on the bottom of each web page similar rumors have been going on for a while and have taken on different forms the universe is not about to realign in december 2014 nor will there be a blackout at that time during which the earth will shift into a new dimension neither nasa nor any other credible scientific entity has made such a pronouncement the site says item originated back in 2012 when interest in the belief that the mayan calendar would end on 21 december 2012 thus foretelling the end of the world as we know it was running high and it has simply been updated and recirculated with the year 2014 replacing the original references to

italian fisherman dino ferrari landed what could potentially be a world record wels catfish in po delta fish measured an incredible feet in length and weighed 280 pounds the current weight record for a wels catfish is over 300 pounds but according to the daily mirror ferrari may have set a record for the largest catfish to be caught with a rod and reel

hbo subscription streaming service will be called hbo now and is expected to cost 15 per month according to the international business times the report says that hbo is targeting a launch for now in early april ahead of the start date for game of thrones while game of thrones would be a great way for hbo to drive subscriptions to the new service it have to be careful if it plans to do that last year hbo online streaming option for cable subscribers hbo go would work for many who were trying to watch during the premiere that would be a very bad look for a new service and the times says that hbo does plan on launching until it satisfied that it can do so without issue apple has been aggressive in its attempts to secure a place as one of hbo launch partners if a deal is made apple tv users would be able to access and stream hbo now potentially through a standalone app apple has been adding more and more channels to the apple tv over the last couple years and the addition of hbo subscription streaming service would make its device all the more appealing the times notes that hbo parent company wants to see this service be accessible on platforms like the roku xbox and playstation as well but it not clear if discussions are ongoing nonetheless it seems likely that hbo would want to work with multiple major partners to get this service out there all of hbo original content and the movies it currently playing it possible that wo be the case hbo may want to position this service as something distinctly different from its cable service as a way to prevent subscribers from moving online on the other hand the 15 per month fee may mean that hbo is earning about as much regardless of how you subscribe that price would make it tougher to compete with netflix but hbo has exactly had trouble finding people willing to pay subscription fees that high in the past with the even wider audience that this service will open it up to hbo may not be that worried

after campaigning on a promise to reform mayor bill de blasio is set to launch his most significant effort to address the issues raised by the policy officials tell the new york times that soon the nypd may issue tickets for marijuana possession rather than making arrests under the de blasio administration planned changes to the city marijuana policy those caught with a small amount of weed would be issued a court summons but avoid a trip to the police station the shift could have a huge impact in black and latino communities as a recent study found those groups represented 86 percent of those arrested for marijuana possession in the city this year such as how much weed one could possess without triggering an arrest and some are already unhappy with the proposed change brooklyn district attorney kenneth thompson who announced this year that he would stop prosecuting marijuana possession cases said that telling people to show up in a court room without arresting them may actually be worse for minorities these cases should be subject to prosecutorial review thompson explained by allowing these cases to avoid early review by issuing a summons there is a serious concern that many summonses will be issued without the safeguards currently in place these cases will move forward even when due process violations might have occurred do expect the debate about how nypd officers should proceed when they catch someone with a joint to be resolved anytime soon

the interwebs was all aflutter today with news that elusive graffiti artist political activist film director painter and long time fugitive that for years has gone by the pseudonymous name of banksy was arrested early this morning by metropolitan police according to reports after hours of questioning and a raid of his london art studio his true name and identity have finally been revealed a video was even produced purporting to reveal real identity a old male born in liverpool england london police chief lyndon edwards held a press conference to answer questions about banksy and how horner was finally apprehended after all these years on the run had a task force monitoring different groups where banksy was known to frequent we received word that around 2am a group of individuals left a flat speculated to be one of art studios this group was followed by agents and once vandalism had occurred we then arrested the group 5 men total these individuals all had id on them except for one and that is the one we believed to be edwards is currently being held without bail on charges of vandalism conspiracy racketeering and counterfeiting we are also holding the other four individuals whose names we are not releasing at this this is a photo of banksy aka paul horner seen here being taken into police custody it must be adage we immediately smelled hoax so did a bit of digging our mascot fido is good at that it take long 30 seconds in fact to rule this out as a fake we reached out to pr agent jo brooks who confirmed the hoax in 3 simple words a man born in bristol england in known for his contempt for the government in labeling graffiti as vandalism banksy displays his art on public walls and even goes as far as to build physical prop pieces he does not sell his work directly however art auctioneers have been known to attempt to sell his street art on location and leave the problem of its removal in the hands of the winning bidder banksy is still a mystery someone somewhere phew

hbo is in talks with apple over a partnership that would see its upcoming standalone subscription television package available on the apple tv reports michael learmonth writing for international business times cnbc has also confirmed that apple and hbo are in talks in the video tweet posted below 2015 which may be called hbo now news of hbo subscription service first surfaced in october of 2014 after hbo ceo richard plepler shared the company plans at an investor presentation aimed at cable cutters will allow users to access hbo content without a cable subscription for a set monthly fee with the launch of a subscription service hbo will become the first major premium content provider to cease limiting its television and movie offerings to cable subscribers hbo subscription will launch in april alongside the premiere of the fifth season of game of thrones which takes place on april the service is said to cost 15 per month which is roughly how much it costs to subscribe to hbo through a cable company a partnership with apple would allow the service to be watched on the apple tv much like the existing version of hbo service hbo go hbo go is available to all existing hbo subscribers on a variety of devices like the ipad and apple tv but it requires an hbo subscription through a cable or satellite provider and it could encourage other content providers to introduce similar offerings content providers reluctance to shift away from traditional cable pricing models has been one of the major factors that prevented apple from establishing deals for its own service in the past tags hbo

it was a heartwarming story for legions of pet owners and animal lovers around the world talking to a distraught boy whose pet had died declared there was a place in heaven for the creatures we share our lives with his comment was reported this week by many news media outside italy with dozens of articles in the united states it was veritable catnip to social media it turned out the pope had not made the comment

who died in 1978 once said reportedly while comforting a child whose dog had died one day we will see our animals in the eternity of christ and in this case it was not done the vatican deputy spokesman father ciro benedettini said on saturday when asked about how the media ran with the story 2014

whose headline was misleading when the topic was the transformation of all creation into a new heaven and a new earth it cited the remark about animals and attributed it to paul vi but its headline said the pope and animals is open to all creatures which ran a story on thursday about the purported comment by francis acknowledged its mistake saying in a correction on friday that it had misattributed the remark by paul vi to the current pope a spokeswoman for the times quoted michael slackman managing editor of international news as saying the correction in the times notes that the specific content and wording were wrong in the article however the pope did in fact make comments suggesting heaven is open to animals the pope referred to heaven saying the sacred scripture teaches us that the fulfillment of this marvelous plan can not but affect all that which surrounds us and which emerged from the thought and the heart of god he did not refer specifically to animals in his remarks cnn also corrected its story noting the misattribution and saying it was unclear what francis believes about pets going to heaven a spokeswoman for cnn had no immediate comment he has not spoken much about them in public but benedettini said that from the general tone of his speeches and gestures it is clear that he is in spiritual harmony with all of creation francis willingly let a young girl place a lamb on his shoulders as a shepherd would carry it the pope once told priests that a good pastor should know not only the names of his parishioners but also the names of their dogs benedettini said pope john paul implied that animals had souls because they too were created from the breath of god in 2008 former pope benedict upset some animal lovers when he said only humans were called to eternity

after a full day spent lying on her back on a muddy wooden plank chipping with painstaking care at the underside of a stone block to free the time capsule hidden within museum of fine arts conservator pam hatchfield sat up in front of the state house to a round of applause a green box held delicately in her hands she said thursday night after posing for a selfie with the capsule for her mom the extrication took more than seven hours and involved about a dozen workers paul revere and william scollay in a ceremony that started in downtown boston and proceeded to the state house according to historical accounts it was unearthed during emergency repairs to the foundation in 1855 and then buried again and had not seen daylight until it emerged on thursday but of our commonwealth and our said secretary of state william galvin who was on hand for the first appearance in more than 150 years according to meghan kelly a spokeswoman for the executive office of administration and finance pam hatchfield a conservator at the museum of fine arts dislodged a time capsule from the cornerstone of the state house pam hatchfield a conservator at the museum of fine arts dislodged a time capsule from the cornerstone of the state house paul revere and william scollay who is head of objects conservation at the museum of fine arts said the corroded copper alloy box that holds the collection was undamaged by the removal process and appeared to be in good shape it was a little smaller than a cigar box and she said heavier than she expected where hatchfield said it will be to determine the contents there was some concern galvin said that there may be some damage to some of the coins which may have been washed in acid before the box was reburied in 1855 said galvin the contents will be examined he said but the time capsule will not remain unburied it will be put back in the box and ultimately back in the which identified the corner where it was hidden as an area of concern according to kelly in october a time capsule was opened after it was removed from its perch in the head of a golden lion statue that had sat atop the old state house in downtown boston its it is the most expensive and many would argue delicious part of a sushi menu scans revealed his entire body had been infected with tapeworm after eating too much sashimi raw slices of fish the hatching larvae attach themselves to the intestinal wall of the fish and the worms infect the fish flesh the larvae can in turn transfer into the flesh of any human that eats the fish a tapeworm will grow inside the intestine to a length of up to 15metres over a period of weeks it can survive for years and go undetected for weeks or months in turn releasing its own eggs that infect other parts of the human body constipation and abdominal discomfort which can be so mild the victim may not notice anything is wrong eyes heart or brain and cause conditions in eastern china found in freshwater fish such as salmon although marinated and smoked fish can also transmit the worm cases have increased in more developed countries say doctors writing in the journal canadian family physician such as raw salted or marinated fillets which originate from baltic and scandinavian countries carpaccio very thin slices of raw fish common in italy raw salmon and ceviche lightly marinated fish of guangzhou no 8 hospital told the website that eating uncooked food contaminated with tapeworms eggs could eventually cause cysticercosis when the adult worms enters a blood stream when the adult worms enters a blood stream and can be fatal

get ready for the tech press to flip out when apple announces the retail price for the gold apple watch edition model apple critics have always roasted the company for selling products that are more expensive than they should be and they frequently use this as a wedge topic to criticize buyers but the apple watch edition will set a whole new bar with a sales price of the funny thing in this case is that apple is perfectly right to be charging that much case against the 10000 gold apple watch this was a bit of the now that it has some readership i realize i should go back and fix the calculations in the article to be more 200 and 1300 per troy ounce and has been over 1000 per troy ounce for the last five years and that term is regulated by law 905 per troy ounce or 480 per cc anywhere from to 8 cc depending on the size and thickness of the case so the buckle is worth 360 and the watch case 720 to 3800 just as raw gold this is why gold watches generally sell for a lot more than 6000 this would equal cc of volume but a watch case so you have to leave room for the movement dial case back etc so just leave 5 mm of thickness all around making a hollow rectangle this equals cc 42 x 36 x 10 32 x 26 x 10 therefore the raw gold to make just the case of this hypothetical watch would cost 3200 as of this writing 300 200 worth 1400 pick your thickness and still looking at thousands of dollars worth of gold 000 more in 18k gold 000 more in 18k gold 000 extra list for 18k gold 000 list 5800 street 000 list 18200 street 750 extra list for 18k gold 550 list 6800 street 300 list 18400 street but the gist is simple gold cases cost a lot more than stainless steel in fact pretty much impossible to find a gold watch for under 10000 in any size and from any manufacturer even tiny quartz ladies watches like the tiny chopard happy sport mini sells for 11000 most of the bargains commenters have pointed to are either or less very slim and small or long out of production and with outdated pricing adding a gold bracelet to that bumps the price to 42900 but one simply can not deny the raw material value in a gold watch case and the gold market is liquid like stocks and other commodities there are plenty of buyers and sellers of gold and plenty of reserves so no company no matter how strong can expect favorable pricing from their suppliers even taking into consideration all the rest of the materials labor distribution and profit in a watch 000 but both represent a traditional offering in the space and both cost more than 20000 with much of that price going to the gold case and matching buckle and jony ive recently said that the historic cartier tank was one of his inspirations for the apple watch design 000 though not going to happen so likely to find ways to reduce the cost dramatically as we can see the apple watch case is highly rounded in all three dimensions although questionable from an esthetic standpoint this reduces the amount of material required by quite a lot second apple watch has a large sapphire crystal front and back with the display sensors and such third the interior frame is likely made of steel or aluminum not gold to reduce cost and increase commonality with the aluminum and steel versions in their press releases they do claim it is from and nowhere does it say it is plated or the industry term there are laws covering descriptions of metal content for jewelry and apple can not break these any more than tiffany could and many bloggers have reported the price for the steel apple watch to be roughly 1000 it is reasonable to assume that the gold edition model will sell for substantially more than this with many suggesting 4000 or 5000 but remember that this price would only cover 4 or 5 ounces of gold even with thin walls and a steel frame hard to see how apple could make a solid gold case and buckle for a 42 mm watch with just 3 ounces of gold but apple claims that their special gold is twice as hard as taking that at face value perhaps they reduced the thickness of the case commensurately cutting the amount of gold in half versus a standard rectangular watch this still leaves a few thousand dollars of material value in the case the apple watch edition will come in 38 mm and 42 mm sizes a difference of about 20 in terms of case volume so the smaller model could sell for 20 less still 999 with the 38 mm apple watch edition retailing for 7999 this covers the cost of the gold case the internals manufacturing sales and profit and yet does not leave apple subsidizing the world gold market by selling at a discount or cheating with a or plated case i will be shocked if the price is 4999 but i suppose possible with some finagling and if the smaller model and it will not be any less than that 000 product 000 product i predict that availability will be quite limited apple will likely create special spaces in certain apple store locations for the edition i further expect them to open special standalone apple edition boutiques to sell the watch edition accessories and perhaps other future products many people disagree with me and now that gruber fireballed this post i imagine hear from lots of them real soon though he was most visually eloquent suspects it contains much less gold but a good lower bound if the case was very thin and completely hollow and it puts the raw gold at about 849 at per gram of 18k gold although this is admittedly much much lower than my estimate it still illustrates my point that the apple watch edition is not going to be cheap and i think way off but time will tell who is right and who is wrong something apple is apparently not going to do with the edition that rolex case contained grams of gold alloy but much much smaller than the apple watch and circular to boot a 34mm circle is 107mm in circumference while the 42mm apple watch is 156mm in circumference use the magic of math to scale the rolex up into a 42mm rectangle and at grams but that case is also much thinner since we excluded the bezel and the apple watch is pretty so we can probably double this safely and come out with 1615 of gold in my mangled square rolex case 500 of gold how much would it sell for certainly not 2000 or 3000 you still have to account for the cost of everything else plus the intangibles of manufacturing and distribution and profit for apple and a hedge against the volatility of the price of gold so back at the 5000 estimate others have made as greg koenig tweeted and forbes reported anyone thinks apple is charging less than 5k for the edition they are smoking important to realize that the price of gold is in the seat when it comes to pricing the apple watch edition and i look forward to updating this piece thanks for reading

new york cnn when war reporter james foley was writing for globalpost or recording video for afp or appearing on the pbs newshour he occasionally shared stories on his own blog aptly titled a world of troubles he chose the famous carl von clausewitz sentence war is fought by human beings the recording was the answer they hoped they never hear to their questions about his disappearance his mother diane said tuesday night brother journalist and person generous new hampshire he had four siblings fellow journalists remembered him for his courage and his generosity alex sherman of bloomberg news wrote on twitter that he was a funny warm big guy max fisher of vox praised his dedication to truth and understanding but it was the wellspring of his generosity anton hammerl who was killed in libya in 2011 and the three who survived wound up in a libyan jail in a video interview with the boston globe he hesitated to make the story about himself remarking at one point that you do want to be defined as guy who got captured in 2011 you know without these photos and videos and experience we ca really tell the world how bad it might be he said clare morgana gillis said his fundraising for hammerl family was the same impulse that compelled him to cut short his break from reporting in syria when a colleague went missing last summer and to raise money for an ambulance for aleppo dar field hospital where he spent weeks filming the plight of doctors who struggled to save lives with minimal space equipment these were acts of service not entirely unlike his time spent in the teach for america program he began teaching in phoenix in 1996 a fellow teach for america alum sarah fang recalled in an essay in 2013 according to a columbia journalism review feature about him first by enrolling at northwestern university medill school of journalism and then by embedding with american troops in iraq and afghanistan while preparing for his first embed he started his blog including globalpost a world news web site founded in 2009 he gravitated toward the spiraling conflict in syria who kept in touch with foley after their years teaching in phoenix wrote that his interest in the story there did not surprise her she wrote jim feels that society needs reporters willing to bear witness and report back the facts of and his loyalty to his colleagues meant that he wanted to be there with them on the frontlines they talked she said about how hard it was to move on from this job into a life which would allow for marriage and family never holding back a tip phone number or detail that could help and could spend hours talking over the ins and outs of a story to get it just right frenkel wrote in an email message and i think he like to be remembered that way first and foremost cbs news foreign correspondent clarissa ward changed her profile picture on twitter to a photo of foley wearing a helmet a flak jacket and holding up a camera she said is how i will chose to remember james as a brave and tireless journalist with a passion for the syrian cause threatens another over iraq the man who will lead iraq

a taliban commander exchanged for the release of a pow attempts to return to the battlefield raising questions about closing guantanamo a soldier who had been held captive for five years his political opponents had a field day they warned that the detainees risked returning to afghanistan and to militancy obama with the backing of the government of qatar that had agreed to host the men promised that they would be kept far from the battlefield seems that the men may have had other ideas according to cnn military and intelligence officials now suspect that at least one of the detainees has made contact with taliban associates in afghanistan suggesting that he and perhaps the others may be planning a return according to a march 2015 assessment by the office of the director of national intelligence it be all that surprising massimo calabresi predicted as much back in june just after bergdahl was released the recidivism rate he wrote that statistically at least one of the taliban leaders will return to the field to fight americans in afghanistan or taliban commanders who had been involved in capture captivity and release told time that the exchange five of theirs for one of would encourage them to seek out more so far that happened not clear which of the five former detainees was reaching out to associates in afghanistan but as commanders and former of taliban leader mullah omar any one of them could galvanize a movement that is slowly making gains in the wake of the drawdown in afghanistan even if those plans have now been foiled the incident may have one other far reaching consequence as obama attempts to close down guantanamo for good his opponents now have more ammunition for why he should not

hailed as a hero kevin vickers photo reuters kevin vickers role is largely ceremonial symbolising the authority of the body and keeping order in the chamber wearing a bicorne hat and tail coat when a lone islamist gunman stormed the building he put pomp and circumstance to one side found a gun and fired the shots that brought the rampage to an end a humble hero at the centre of attention applauded to the rafters by members of parliament after a career in the royal canadian mounted police reaching the rank of chief superintendent but he is not usually armed where he took cover in an alcove next to mr vickers office threw himself to the ground to present a smaller target and shot the assailant three times a family member told local media his brother john said very proud of him and what he had to endure today his automatic pistol still in his hand at his side justice minister peter mackay said in a twitter message said canadian broadcasting corporation reporter kady the humble officer said he was very touched by all the attention but said it must be shared with his remarkable security team during extraordinary circumstances security personnel demonstrated professionalism and courage i am grateful and proud to be part of this team he said he was born in chatham new brunswick

international experts have raised doubts as to whether a 40ft crater near the nicaraguan capital managua was caused by a meteorite wilfried strauch said he was convinced it was a meteorite which caused the impact it would have generated a very bright fireball and nothing was reported a mechanic who lives less than a kilometre from the site of the crater said that he heard the explosion and felt the shockwave which was very strong a scientist who advises the nicaraguan presidency on environmental matters said it was possible nobody was looking up at the sky when the event took place close to midnight he said that a meteor capable of such force would have created a fireball visible over a wide area and the typical characteristic that it produces a cone in the place of impact he added so the explosion and the asteroid are unrelated ranging from ordinance to someone out blowing things up

washington ap airstrikes earlier this week killed the leader of the terrorist group in somalia the pentagon said friday president barack obama said the death of ahmed abdi godane demonstrated counterterrorism resolve and was an example of his deliberate approach to dismantling affiliated groups navy rear john kirby announced the death in a brief written statement it took the pentagon four days to conclusively determine that godane had not survived monday airstrikes saying they have an opportunity to embrace peace following godane death this is a chance for the majority of members of to change course and reject godane decision to make them the pawns of an international terror campaign he said in a statement speaking at the conclusion of a nato summit in newport wales told reporters the success against should leave no doubt about his determination to degrade and eventually destroy the islamic state group in iraq and syria the military announced later friday that a mix of fighter jets drones attack planes and bombers launched four airstrikes thursday and friday in northern iraq destroying a host of islamic state targets including an observation post an armed vehicle and three mortar positions which evolved from an affiliate that sprouted in iraq in 2004 obama said that deliberation allows us to do it right but have no doubt we will continue to do what is necessary to protect the american people said army steven warren a pentagon spokesman a meeting of regional commanders will have to take place to pick his successor said matt bryden the head of sahan research in nairobi kenya bryden predicted the meeting will be difficult and dangerous to organize a somali analyst who runs a think tank called the heritage institute for policy studies predicted that godane death will almost certainly be the beginning of the end of the organization he said had gradually become a guerrilla movement that avoided conventional warfare tactics that suited it amid mounting military pressure from african union troops and government forces who was born in 1977 and raised in the town of hargeisa in the autonomous region of somaliland was said to be a quiet boy who was interested in the quran and islamic studies in his early years his relatives there described him as a private man who was devoted to islamic teachings at mosques said mohamed hassan a former senior somali intelligence official in somaliland who once was tasked with tracking down godane over charges the future terror leader stole money when he worked for a local telecommunications company in somaliland he also had been accused of involvement in the murder of foreigners working at local charities before he joined the islamic courts union precursor group that once controlled mogadishu and many parts of somalia before it was ousted by ethiopian forces wales associated press writers jason struziuso in cairo rodney muhumuza in uganda abdi guled in mogadishu somalia and josh lederman and sagar meghani in washington contributed to this report

apple will offer a low power mode on apple watch to help boost it through longer days according to a new report that also takes a stab at dispelling rumors that the company may have elected to all some sensors last minute most current and upcoming smartwatches including the apple watch will last no more than a day on a single charge to help mitigate this issue apple has reportedly developed a still unannounced software feature of the apple watch called power reserve according to the new york times it said to cut power to all functions and display only the time helping to extend the watch life in cases where a recharge may not be possible the function is similar in concept to the battery saver mode in android which can push smartphone battery life from minutes to hours by reducing processor use requiring a fresh charge at night although standard among smartwatches the issue has created controversy since many had been hoping apple would solve the smartwatch industry battery woes with its inaugural effort apple decision to abandon some advanced health tracking features came over 18 months ago rather than at the last minute early experiments in tracking factors like blood pressure and stress are said to have been ditched after the sensors proved unreliable and otherwise unworkable instead the device only features motion and sensors once again mirroring some competing smartwatches noting that apple not only encountered technical difficulties in achieving its ideal design but was also forced to battle the loss of key engineers some of whom were poached by home automation outfit nest labs among them was bryan james who became an engineering vice president at nest early last year for which apple engineers created dummy casing including some resembling samsung smartwatches

we just over a week away from learning a whole lot more about the apple watch but the new york times has just revealed a few more details about the new smartwatch apple employees involved with the project tell the paper that there will be a special battery stretch feature called power reserve the mode will let the apple watch continue displaying the time and nothing else even with scant battery life left there just is much space for a battery cell that can keep the device charged for a long time reports say that the watch will require nightly charging apple engineers who been putting the device through its paces have kept the apple watch in a case that makes it look like one of samsung gear smartwatches the report also says that designers originally intended to include sensors to monitor stress and blood pressure but those ideas were dropped after struggles with the sensors

an alleged bug in ios 8 appears to be deleting documents stored in icloud drive without the user permission the bug is triggered by the option to reset all settings the reset all settings option is supposed to simply reset your ios settings but leave your data and media untouched yet several forum users say that not the case as certain icloud documents also vanished after they reset all settings the bug seems to be specific to documents from iwork apps such as pages keynote and numbers macrumors said one user reported that his iwork documents were deleted after resetting all settings but other data files remained in icloud one user wrote because ios 8 was so sluggish on my ipad 3 i reset all settings no data or media will be deleted and sped it up but deleted my iwork data then promptly synced and deleted it in icloud another forum user wrote i had a bit of weird behaviour on my ipad so i figured it would hurt to just reset all settings for the hell of it i did it on my iphone as well all documents lost how on earth does resetting settings with a clear notice that data will not be lost wipe out icloud drive it embarassing a third person reported success with time machine at least running the beta of os x yosemite several of the affected users say they contacted apple support personnel who are investigating the issue using reset all settings deleted all iwork documents stored in icloud drive on the iphone and on after allowing time for syncing to a mac running os x yosemite all of the documents disappeared from that machine as well preview and textedit documents which can not be accessed on the iphone remained untouched on the mac microsoft onedrive and other storage services beyond just syncing your files between your ios devices and icloud you can directly store and retrieve documents and other files on icloud drive just as you can store and retrieve them locally

according the latest in a string of scoops from 9to5mac battery life has been a pressing concern for apple throughout the development of the apple watch and for the first time sources familiar with the watch development have provided some early figures on what consumers can expect when the device ships sometime this year in short apple watch will exhibit similar longevity to what we seen from many android wear devices on the market today the company is said to be shooting for to 4 hours of active application use with the screen turned on that vary depending on how heavily you use it of course but since the wearable display will often be turned off throughout the day and because the iphone handles a lot of computing tasks apple is apparently hopeful that the watch can make it from morning until you place it back on the wireless charger at night 19 hours of combined active and passive use seems to be the bar as of right now the pebble smartwatch continues to blow away the field in terms of battery life but it a very different device when compared against a moto 360 or the apple watch in standby and modes 9to5mac sources say apple watch can last through two or three days and if for some reason you want to use it strictly as a timepiece and leave the screen on at all times it die out after three or so hours using it as a workout companion your gym routine should last more than four hours 000 units as the development process continues and while the iphone is a critical companion to apple watch the device itself may be more powerful than some expected 9to5mac says the cpu inside is more or less equally as powerful as the a5 chip that powered the iphone 4s and ipad 2 and remains in the ipod touch considering the tiny form factor we expecting the same fluidity and responsiveness that have become hallmarks of ios but as for the battery apple can only do so much the simple fact is that battery technology does evolve at nearly the same rate as the smartphones in our pockets and wearables on our wrists the company will undoubtedly keep pushing for improvements as apple watch launch nears it expected to ship beginning in march

while child entrepreneurs have become increasingly common in the last decade not many hit the lofty heights that mohammed islam reached when his trading earnings reached the eight islam a teenager from queens still lives at home with his parents but has been trading on the stock exchange on his lunch breaks at stuyvesant high school the teen wolf is the son of immigrants from bengal in south asia mohammed trades with two other friends and they hope to start a hedge fund when the teen wolf turns 18 and graduates from high school learning to play sports and figuring out fractions mohammed was putting his tutoring earnings to work as often happens on the stock exchange islam lost his initial investment he describes the event as and swore off the market thinking he just have the required nerves of steel islam turned to studying modern finance and became enthralled with paul tudor jones jones is a billionaire from connecticut who manages hedge funds and private assets as is often the case much of success came on the heels of failure thousands and thousands of dollars lost over and over but jones kept coming back for more and ultimately captured overwhelming success that fortitude paired with his positive outlook inspired mohammed to give the game another try and like the man who inspired him mohammed islam has become a resounding success in his own right another young trader who had an uncanny ability to make money on the stock exchanges islam and his trading buddies intend to become billionaires by next year if businesses keep going no innovation no products no investments no growth no not just about the money all of us who are connected who are in something together who have islam is shy and modest and only gave a rough estimate of his earnings while he has a very bright future and grand dreams for his journey into it for now he has to content himself with expensive meals at morimoto an upscale japanese restaurant a high end bmw that he has no license to drive and a swanky manhattan apartment that not old enough to move into and as the inquisitr pointed out even the movie was beleaguered in controversy and monetary fraud hopefully the catchy nickname can be by the smart and tenacious teen from new york city

if the past few weeks of nonstop media onslaught about north korea and the interview just quite appeased your insatiable appetite for kim antics fear are other things literally cooking up his tunic sleeves the uk rag the daily mail reports that the dictator is eyeing scotland as the location for his next business expansion of the restaurant chain known as pyongyang which is owned by the north korean government and used to generate additional cash flow overseas there are currently franchises in cities such as beijing shanghai kuala lampur jakarta and more recently amsterdam scotland has allegedly been singled out for two reasons the first is that kim and other elite north korean officials love drinking scotch whisky his father the late kim was a bigger fan of hennessy supposedly spending some a year on the cognac kim was allegedly a supporter of the independence choe managing editor of north korean paper choson sinbo told daily korea is rich in natural resources and we like the taste of scotch whisky so scotland and north korea can be beneficial to each the daily mail claims that the other reason why north korea might single out scotland is that they want to make nice with some european countries in hopes of improving diplomacy and their global image north korean leadership watch editor michael madden tells the mail that kim has been trying to think of ways to buddy up with scotland ever since its bid for sovereignty and has more hope for acceptance there than in those other judgy european countries like england and france madden also claims that tourists in north korea are already encouraged to pay tips in scotch rather than won the local currency korea is going to support any country struggling for independence and legitimacy as north korea itself still continues to seek validation and recognition of its own legitimacy as a sovereign in this case that may mean trying to snuggle up with a pyongyang franchise that will attempt to win over the scots via dishes such as barbecued cuttlefish kimchi gruel dog meat soup and a mysterious aphrodisiac made out of bears although these foods are served at other pyongyang restaurants there is no specific evidence that make their way onto menus in scotland a korean embassy official recently denied the story to the independent but as it is with many other businesses in north korea many critics believe that cash flow from the restaurant chain goes straight to himself and his small group of elites with virtually no to the north korean people 31 gained quite a bit of attention earlier this year for his diagnosis of gout a disease commonly caused by overindulgence in rich fatty foods it was widely reported that he became ill and developed a limp and facial swelling because he had become literally addicted to emmental more commonly called so unclear whether tipping in whisky would be encouraged

a former american soldier from wisconsin who has become the face of the ypg kurdish military force in syria told upi wednesday in an exclusive interview that civilians have been burned in an islamic state attack with injuries consistent with chemical weapons 28 a former army soldier speaking from derik syria said his information comes from walat omar the head field doctor in the embattled border town of kobane which is encircled by is militants matson and others in the area said the injuries were caused by chemical weapons i contacted the local field doctor on the ground in kobane and he had sent me many pictures from the hospital matson said in his first video interview with media a native of sturtevant wisconsin arrived in syria last month via iraq and quickly became the public face of the ypg he said laughing a head scarf and carrying a weapon now appearing across ypg social media accounts although the public role was thrown on me matson is quick to add he happy to play it because an italian expert studying a first century document written by the roman historian marcus velleius paterculus that was recently discovered in the archives of the vatican found what is presumed to be the first eyewitness account ever recorded of a miracle of jesus christ the author describes a scene that he allegedly witnessed in which a prophet and teacher that he names iēsous de nazarenus resuscitated a stillborn boy and handed him back to his mother was hired by the vatican authorities in 2012 to sort analyze and classify some 6000 ancient documents that had been uncovered in the gigantic archive vaults he was already very excited when he noticed that the author of the text was the famous roman historian velleius but he was completely stunned when he realized the nature of the content while searching amongst a bundle of personal letters and other trivial documents dating from the roman era recorded in a highly rhetorical style of four sheets of parchment he describes many different episodes taking place during his trip like a a violent sandstorm in mesopotamia and visit to a temple in melitta modern day mdina in malta in the west bank the author first describes the arrival of a great leader in the town with a group of disciples and followers causing many of the lower class people from neighbouring villages to gather around them according to velleius that great name was iēsous de nazarenus a translation of hebrew name yeshua hanotzri jesus would have visited the house of a woman named elisheba who had just given birth to a stillborn child jesus picked up the dead child and uttered a prayer in aramaic to the heavens which unfortunately the author describes as meaning incomprehensible to the surprise and amazement the baby came back to life almost immediately crying and squirming like a healthy newborn being a roman officer of campanian origins seems to perceive jesus christ as a great doctor and miracle man without associating him in any way to the jewish concept of messiah the literary style and handwriting have all been carefully scrutinized and were considered to be entirely legitimate the dating analysis also revealed that the sheepskin parchment on which the text is written does indeed date from the 1st century of this era more precisely from between ad brings a brand new perspective on the life of the historical character that is jesus of nazareth it comes to confirm the gospels on the facts that he was known for accomplishing miracles and that his sheer presence in a town was enough to attract crowds of people but the impact of the discovery is already felt in the scientific community many scholars have already saluted the finding as one of the greatest breakthrough ever realized in the study of the historical life of jesus while others have expressed doubts about the conclusions of professor perrucci and demand for more tests to be performed by other scientific institutions before drawing any conclusions

according to the latest research from our wde wearables research service the apple watch smartwatch will ship 15 million units worldwide in apple will quickly become the number one smartwatch vendor with 55 percent global marketshare this year which we forecast to ship million units worldwide in apple will quickly become the number one smartwatch vendor and capture 55 percent global marketshare this year loyal fan base deep retail presence and extensive apps ecosystem will ensure healthy uptake for its watch however watch is not yet perfect for example watch hardware design is arguably less attractive than some rival models such as the huawei watch battery life may not be as long as many traditional wristwatch owners are used to and premium pricing may be challenging for consumers apple will need to upgrade tangibly its watch to stay ahead of competitors later this year

the smartwatch that apple initially envisioned is not the same one the company will unveil next month according to a new report heart activity stress levels and other functions the wall street journal reported monday citing sources familiar with the device but none of those features will make it into the final product due to a variety of issues according to the journal some features did work properly others proved too complex and some would have required regulatory approval as such apple was forced to scale back the range and depth of health features for its first entry into the smartwatch arena the sources said the apple watch will enter an already crowded playing field competing with products from samsung sony motorola microsoft lg and others it been thought that apple postponed its release of a smartwatch at least in part to perfect the health and fitness monitoring features but if the journal sources are correct some of those features proved more challenging than expected the journal reported apple tested sensors to measure skin conductivity which would have helped monitor stress levels and heart rate but the sensors ran into inconsistencies with different people such as those with hairy arms or dry skin and the results were mixed based on how tightly you wore the watch according to the journal sources but again the results were inconsistent further if those features strayed into the area of actually providing medical advice they would have required approval from the food and drug administration something apple was trying to avoid one of the sources said apple has been touting its first smartwatch as more of an wearable yes several key health and fitness features will be available and useful especially as developers create apps to tap into that market but apple is also busy promoting other aspects of the watch including its variety of styles its ability to act as an adjunct to the iphone its support for apple pay and its controls piper jaffray analyst gene munster projected unit sales of 8 million for wall street has been forecasting sales of 12 million to 15 million apple has reportedly asked its suppliers to manufacture 5 million to 6 million watches for its first quarter of release apple will certainly come out with future models those could even include some of the health features that did pass muster the first time around the journal sources added

apple has remained mum as to its pricing strategy for the three versions of the apple watch to be made available next year only saying that the price will start at 350 for the version likely to be the apple watch sport which features light aluminum and a band made from a rubbery material which comes with yellow gold or rose gold a sapphire crystal display and venetian leather for its bands will cost around 1200 with other jewelers estimating that apple fanciest smartwatch could be priced as much as 10000 penn told techcrunch that an gold case that is the size and shape of the apple watch could rack up as much as 600 for the raw material that does not even include the smartwatch electronic components and the profit margin apple plans to tack on to the device all in all consumers can expect to pay 1200 for a gold smartwatch says rickicki other jewelers are not as optimistic saying that we need to understand the materials apple used for its smartwatch to be able to peg it at a more accurate price ariel adams founder and editor of watch blog ablogtowatch says apple adopted watch industry terminology for the apple watch the term gold he says likely means the watch is made of solid gold not otherwise apple would have used the term 200 per ounce if for example the apple watch weighs two ounces that is already 2400 just for the gold that is not even considering the special process apple own metallurgists invented to create gold that is twice as hard as standard gold adams says apple has cheaper manufacturing centers in china than the facilities used by watchmakers but gold is gold and it is expensive wherever it is crafted estimating that apple has to pay around 30 to 40 for the sapphire crystal case of the edition smart watch sapphire manufacturing adams says is a long and expensive process where the crystals are synthetically grown in large chambers and then cut into rectangles that are then laminated adams thinks the apple watch will not cost anything less than 5000 and could go up as much as 10000 far less than the steel version he says i think it going to have a much different type of distribution it be a much more exclusive product

throughout the years of the syrian civil war one refrain among some american officials has been that arming syrian moderates whoever they may be is a dicey proposition because the weapons could fall into the wrong hands the united states eventually sent military aid to the free syrian army last year the policy change was precipitated by syrian dictator bashar assad violation of the obama administration red line after the regime used chemical weapons against civilians with the rise of isis in mind congress approved the president plan to to train and arm the syrian rebels there was some familiar dissent at the time how will we ensure that the united states weapons we are providing to syrian rebels will not get into the wrong hands as they did with the rebels we supported in libya representative barbara lee asked islamic state fighters first encircled kobani a syrian town near the turkish border attacking the largely kurdish town and inspiring vigorous american airstrikes on monday hoping to decisively turn the tide in the battle the united states airdropped weapons to the syrian kurds of kobani by way of explanation especially to a skeptical turkish audience secretary of state john kerry offered that not aiding the kurds in their fight against isis is both irresponsible and morally very difficult with that one airdrop the weight of the american dread about where its weapons might go also landed according to the associated press some of the weapons meant to reach the kurds ended up in islamic state hands instead ammunition and grenade launchers according to a video uploaded by a media group loyal to the islamic state british activist group added that more than one cache of weapons might have been snatched up by islamic state fighters this would be the first time that islamic state fighters have captured american weapons this might just have been the easiest

crews removed a time capsule dating back to 1795 on thursday from the granite cornerstone of the massachusetts statehouse where historians believe it was originally placed by revolutionary war luminaries samuel adams and paul revere among others documents newspapers and a metal plate that was owned by revere then open it next week a conservator at the boston museum of fine arts holds a time capsule she had just removed from the cornerstone of the statehouse in boston on thursday the time capsule was believed to have been embedded in the cornerstone when construction on the state capitol began in adams was governor of massachusetts at the time galvin said its removal thursday was due to an ongoing water filtration project at the building galvin said the plan is to return it to the site sometime next year a conservator at the museum was exhausted thursday after spending hours chiseling and drilling on the massive cornerstone taking care not to damage the time capsule or coins that were thrown in the mortar that held it in place documents newspapers and a metal plate that was owned by revere secretary of state william galvin speculated that some of the items could have deteriorated over time a conservator at the boston museum of fine arts holds the time capsule reporters and contractors involved in the renovation of the statehouse hatchfield said feel happy and relieved and excited and really interested to see what in this box hatchfield said put the contents back into a new box and placed it in a depression in the stone which is on the underside galvin said the corner of the statehouse where the capsule was fixed has had a water leakage problem for 30 years active statehouses in the country he said the biggest question we have right now are the contents in good condition or not active statehouses in the country when we talk about the original box being presided over by sam adams paul revere it pretty significant he said very fond of saying that the history of massachusetts is the history of america and it very true and this is another evidence of that which served as the state first seat of government that time capsule dating to 1901 turned up in a lion statue atop the building and when opened was found to contain a potpourri of items including newspaper clippings a book on foreign policy and a letter from journalists of the period

the state of north dakota has named a new landfill after president barack obama the state senate advanced a bill naming a site currently under construction after the 44th president governor jack dalrymple is expected to sign the measure into law tuesday the barack obama memorial landfill will be the largest waste disposal site in north dakota and the 17th largest in the united states it will be especially rich in toxic waste from the local petroleum and medical industries says republican state senator doug perlman who was the lead sponsor of the bill i think a pile of garbage is a fitting tribute to presidency although that figure may have fallen further in the year since yet even considering the political climate seasoned observers are surprised that two democratic lawmakers voted for the passage a progressive democrat from grand forks he decided to fight new wars abroad instead of fighting for health care and jobs here at home says joe blough a plumber from minot darkly colored and it full of shit that pretty much sums up

though apple was mum about battery life for its forthcoming accessory when it was announced on tuesday the company has since said that it expects people to charge it nightly suggesting the battery life will offer about one day of operation apple spokeswoman nat kerris said in a statement to we anticipate that people will charge nightly which is why we designed an innovative charging solution that combines our magsafe technology and inductive charging and indicated that the company is happy with the current uptime of the apple watch one person said the watch battery life is currently about a day and that the company is working on modifications ahead of its launch to improve it including devices running the competing android wear platform like the pebble which utilizes a monochrome display and lacks a touchscreen pebble screen is always on and provides up to a week of use before the device needs to be recharged but declined to offer a more specific window including pricing while the apple watch will start at 349 a breakdown of how much various models will cost was not given it possible that the models could reach into a price point the luxury apple watch edition is made of hardened gold and existing gold watches typically sell for more than 10000

when you complain to your cable company you certainly expect that the cable company will then contact your employer and discuss your complaint but exactly what happened to one former comcast customer who says he was fired after the cable company called a partner at his accounting firm there were issues with his service as he was being charged for boxes that had yet to be activated additionally someone at comcast billing had misspelled last name meaning some of his bills were not being delivered but things only got worse the promotional discount shrunk and monthly bill increased by 20 in addition to still being charged for unactivated devices in his house comcast also twice charged him an additional 7 for a second modem he did not have attempts to get a resolution from comcast went unanswered sending conal about a dozen pieces of equipment that he order modem standard boxes and equipment that i was unfamiliar he says comcast billed him 1820 for all this stuff never requested and had no use for being an experienced accountant at one of the most prestigious firms even prepared a spreadsheet detailing every charge overcharge payment and credit on his account for his brief time as a comcast customer comcast sent account into collections in 2014 2014 he chose to try going above customer service which been of any help in the year been a subscriber and instead contacted the office of the controller he spoke to someone in that office who promised conal would receive a call back to address the issues with the rep not identifying which company she was calling from just starting out with can i help you then she kept insisting that a technician had shown up for an appointment but specify which appointment the rep then began asking him for the color of his house to let them know that the rep sent his way had failed miserably at her job he says that he mentioned that billing and accounting issues should probably be investigated by the public company accounting oversight board pcaob a oversight operation this ultimately led to two service calls where no one ever showed up and no explanations were given prestigious accounting firm comcast certainly noticed that fact especially since that firm is one that does business with comcast someone from comcast contacted a partner at the firm to discuss conal this led to an ethics investigation and subsequent dismissal from his job a job where he says only received positive feedback and reviews for his work but believes that someone in the comcast office looked him up online and figured out where he worked employer explained that the reason for the dismissal was an from comcast that summarized conversations between conal and comcast employees it was not the accounting firm that audited books so conal quite see how mentioning the name of his employer would have helped gain him any leverage but not out of the question senior deputy general counsel admits that the company did contact employer but says that conal not in a position to complain that the firm came to about his dispute with comcast second third fourth fifth or sixth chance that he gave comcast to address the issue the call in question would never have happened he have been trying to get preferential treatment just the service paid for even though comcast insists that conal attempted to leverage his place of business to get his issue resolved it has not specifically cited language that he allegedly used in the call but a rep for comcast did give a brief statement reads the statement comcast says it has previously apologized to conal but adds will review his letter and respond as quickly as

kim not deposed just having ankle surgery photo afp the north korean leader who has mysteriously been missing from the public eye for almost a month sparking rumours ranging from a stroke to a coup is apparently just recovering from ankle surgery the chosun ilbo south korea largest newspaper reported on tuesday citing an unnamed source the source said adding that the leader had had the operation at the bonghwa clinic an exclusive hospital for party members the world most impenetrable country that rumours spread like wildfire but they are almost always impossible to verify it is true that mr kim has become noticeably more rotund since he took over the leadership of north korea from his father kim in december he was pictured limping in july during a ceremony to commemorate the 20th anniversary of the death of his grandfather former north korean leader kim causing speculation about his health the leader of north korea missed a regular session of the supreme people assembly in pyongyang he has not been seen in public since september 3 when he attended a concert with his wife the rumours went into overdrive when the korean central tv said the great successor was in an indisposed condition our marshal continues to come out and lead the people said the narrator of a documentary called improving the lives of the people showing footage of kim limping through the taedonggang tile factory last month which runs in the family or has been drinking and eating too much diabetes and high blood pressure have also been put forward as possible causes of his absence china version of twitter went crazy this week with reports that jo myong rok a north korean who died four years ago had overthrown kim in a coup and sent his lieutenants to south korea for negotiations talk spread so quickly that the global times one of china official papers ran a commentary on monday titled for those who make up rumours of coup in north korea is it so funny

beirut ap lebanese authorities detained a woman and young boy believed to be the wife and son of the reclusive islamic state group leader and were questioning the woman and conducting dna tests on the child senior lebanese officials said tuesday lebanon may use the pair as bargaining chips to win the release of soldiers and police taken hostage by the extremists in attacks earlier this year who was identified as an iraqi and the child were taken into custody about 10 days ago while carrying fake id cards the officials said including how many wives and children he has conservative interpretations of islam allow men to marry up to four wives the islamic state group did not immediately comment on the detentions but the faction supporters on twitter and militant websites cast doubt on the reports the lebanese army did not release an official statement regarding the pair syria branch earlier this year the official said the woman confessed during interrogation that she was wife the nusra front freed more than a dozen greek orthodox nuns in exchange for the release of dozens of female prisoners by the syrian government a woman named saja was reportedly on the list of prisoners freed by damascus saqr saqr and that a dna test was underway to confirm that the child is her son experts said it would be difficult to confirm whether the woman is indeed wife where is controls no territory and enjoys only small although growing support in some predominantly sunni muslim areas who has a 10 million bounty on his head he has only made one known public appearance a sermon he delivered in july at a mosque in mosul just days after is declared him the head of an islamic state or caliphate in the territory the group controls in syria and iraq iraqi officials claimed he was wounded in an airstrike the has not confirmed those reports and released a new audiotape days after he was purportedly hit saying the woman and boy were taken into custody near a border crossing point with syria it said the arrest came in coordination with foreign intelligence agencies the detentions could give lebanese authorities leverage in their attempts to reach a deal with militants from the islamic state group and the nusra front the extremists have been holding more than 20 lebanese soldiers and policemen hostage since august and have demanded the release of islamist prisoners held by lebanon on monday night the nusra front threatened to kill one of the soldiers it holds captive militants ambushed a lebanese army patrol near the frontier killing six soldiers and wounding one lebanon military said the attack occurred in a remote region of ras baalbek in eastern lebanon and was followed by clashes the army said in a statement but there was no immediate indication that it was connected to the detention of alleged family members supporters of the islamic state group released a video claiming responsibility for a shooting that wounded a danish citizen in the saudi capital of riyadh last month posted online monday by the media foundation shows a gunman pulling up beside a vehicle and firing five times at the man inside identified as thomas hoepner the video authenticity could not be confirmed but it was posted on a website commonly used by militants and that he was treated for shoulder wounds they did not release his name the shooting would be the first attack on foreigners in the kingdom carried out by islamic state supporters about a decade ago militants seeking to topple the monarchy launched a wave of attacks that killed scores of security forces and westerners in saudi arabia danish foreign minister martin lidegaard told reporters tuesday that the dane is doing better maamoun youssef in cairo and aya batrawy in dubai united arab emirates contributed to this report

apple is planning to open a dedicated shop for the apple watch at department store selfridges in london according to sources the shop will likely be located near the entrance of the iconic wonder room a shopping hall that houses a wide selection of luxury jewelry and watch brands alongside a concept store and mezzanine wine bar sources say the concept will display various apple watch models and provide customers with a personalized shopping experience potentially including one to one service for those interested in learning more about the device which is likely to be this selfridges boutique the shop is expected to be readied in time for the apple watch launch in april and will likely join galeries lafayette as one of multiple standalone apple watch stores that apple plans to open throughout europe such as watches bracelets earrings necklaces pendants and rings with the apple watch positioned at least partially as a fashion item the department store offers an ideal setting for the device to be displayed
