the new york police department which has been arresting tens of thousands of people a year for marijuana possession is poised to stop making such arrests and to issue tickets instead according to law enforcement officials and this year the new brooklyn district attorney kenneth thompson said he would stop prosecuting such cases but his announcement did not go over well with de blasio and his police commissioner william bratton who vowed to continue making marijuana arrests the de blasio administration is publicly embracing the notion that such possession merits different treatment and with the changes city hall is moving to retake control of a politically potent issue that has enormous resonance in the black and latino communities where a vast majority of marijuana arrests have taken place blacks and hispanics represented 86 percent of those arrested for marijuana possession in the city according to a study written in part by harry levine a sociology professor at queens college who is a director of the marijuana arrest research project and many questions remain unanswered under the new policy for example will the 25 grams or less that constitutes misdemeanor possession under state law be the threshold below which a summons is issued will a lit marijuana cigarette be treated differently from a packet of unsmoked cannabis other key questions such as the cost of the fines or whether a criminal record would typically result from a summons may not be up to city hall as de blasio prepares for his first meeting with the five district attorneys a spokeswoman for the mayor marti adams declined to comment on the proposed policy change although officials in two of the district offices confirmed that the de blasio administration was working on a new policy for how the police handle marijuana cases thompson expressed concern about the plan calling it an around the district attorneys that could end up hurting some of the very people the changes are supposed to help the brooklyn district office has dismissed 849 misdemeanor marijuana cases involving police arrests or about 34 percent of the total 2526 such cases in brooklyn it appears that instead of being arrested those given a ticket for marijuana will be told to appear in a courtroom but the new policy could push prosecutors out of the process because summonses issued without an accompanying arrest generally do not receive prosecutorial review these cases should be subject to prosecutorial thompson said allowing these cases to avoid early review by issuing a summons there is a serious concern that many summonses will be issued without the safeguards currently in place these cases will move forward even when due process violations might have the brooklyn district attorney credit bebeto press but the illegal unconstitutional stop and frisk a highly addictive substance lethal in a myriad of ways with no established medicinal use and which is the 1 gateway he said there are currently about million active warrants in new york relating to missed court dates and unpaid fines for misdemeanors and noncriminal violations in 2013 people failed to pay or show up to court about a quarter of the time for the 329198 summons cases on the dockets of the lowest level criminal courts according to court statistics more than half of those arrested for marijuana were released a couple of hours after being brought to a station house according to 2012 data gathered by the criminal justice agency a nonprofit that assists with bail determinations they were fingerprinted checked for warrants and issued a ticket demanding their appearance in court six to eight weeks later the remainder of those arrested for marijuana possession were through the meaning they were held for up to 24 hours before being arraigned before a judge the debate over marijuana arrests has been less about drug decriminalization than it has been about the aggressive tactics that came to define the police strategies during the bloomberg administration the police arrested as many as 50000 people a year on minor marijuana charges meaning that some years approximately one in eight arrests made by the police was for marijuana in some cases arrests were made after officers stopped people under dubious circumstances and instructed them to remove any contraband from their pockets the legislature in new york moved to decriminalize possession of small amounts of marijuana that were not in public view that meant that carrying a small bag of marijuana hidden in a pocket was supposed to be a violation that did not amount to a crime but since the the police have routinely arrested people they found with marijuana and charged them with a misdemeanor even though it was only supposed to apply to marijuana that was burning or discovered in in 2011 the police commissioner at the time raymond kelly issued an unusual order reminding officers that the misdemeanor was not the appropriate charge in many cases

the police still arrested more than 28000 people for marijuana possession and in 2014 the arrests were occurring at a similar pace professor levine said de blasio a democrat emphatically criticized the marijuana arrest practices his populist outrage against policing in minority neighborhoods helped propel him into city hall but since becoming mayor in january he has exerted little pressure on the department instead often deferring to commissioner bratton who has made a national reputation for aggressive street policing combined with an ability to soothe the relations between police departments and the minority neighborhoods they serve the departures of the top hispanic official and its black officer have led a number of minority lawmakers and city hall allies to begin to question de oversight of the police

the studio this is the end last year and will star in the interview in december including the social network in it will be told in three sequences focusing on apple launches of the ipod next and the macintosh particularly his relationships sorkin said in april a fascinating guy part hero part antihero a fascinating guy surrounded by fascinating people and he had very interesting relationships with the people in his life sorkin confirmed this year that he finished the film script sorkin said but steve jobs is one of the very few times i ended up writing what i set out to write an incredibly satisfying feeling so it will be fascinating to see what he has to say about rogen even today in 2011 motorola attempted to spoof the classic ad in a promotional spot for its xoom tablet the audience reacted with boos and hisses still the decision to partner with microsoft and have microsoft commit to producing software for the macintosh was one of the most shrewd and likely one of the most intelligent decisions that jobs made upon his return to apple the reality is without microsoft investment and commitment to developing macintosh software the company may have had a more difficult time getting its next line of products to the market the imac was sleek modern and affordable this was not the macintosh of the early to mid 1990s it was something new apple became cool we can vividly remember looking at the design with the hockey puck mouse and famous lack of a floppy drive and being transfixed the imac marked the beginning of apple apple debuted the ipod famously ridiculed and dismissed by slashdot it would be several years before the device would become iconic and in the process change apple fundamentally as a company 000 songs in your pocket its the execution that set the device apart from everyone else apple flipped the switch again with the launch of the itunes music store in a industry most were skeptical that itunes could drive music sales eight years later itunes is the number one music retailer by a large margin the ipod is getting long in the tooth but it still remains the leader in its product category the rumors of an ipod phone started to swirl while also it and predicted its failure its success has outpaced nearly every other technology product launch in history and is having a seismic impact on education publishing media consumption and computing in general but i willing to bet that the computer i use every day in 10 years will have a lot more in common with the ipad than the macbook pro

in designing its first wearable device in the apple watch apple looked to incorporate a variety of highly advanced health functions with an eye on creating a holistic monitoring device but ultimately scrapped those plans due to technological and regulatory hurdles sources claim apple watch was supposed to be much more than the device unveiled last year and slated to launch in april specifically apple executives wanted to produce a cutting edge tool one capable of measuring a user blood pressure heart rate stress level and more said people familiar with the matter apple watch boasts a variety of sensors including accelerometers touch inputs and a bespoke optical heart rate sensor the latter of which connects to the ios health app for fitness and wellness tracking while polished and presented in a slick package apple watch is powered by technology on a par with competing devices running flavors of android a number of standalone solutions for medical style monitoring already exist in the form of products usually from smaller manufacturers and startups for example the band incorporates a specialized sensor to measure a user autonomic nervous system for keeping track of stress levels while the latest products from fitbit tout heart rate monitoring with an eye on health and fitness but the project was quickly dubbed a black hole for sucking in resources advanced technology and component reliability failed to meet apple rigorous standards sources said skin conductivity sensors showed promise in early designs but later testing showed actual results varied person to person with everything from hairy arms to strap tightness contributing to unreliable readings the company also investigated incorporating blood pressure and blood oxygen measurement features but results were inconsistent as evidenced by recently discovered job postings but will take a more mainstream approach for the first generation watch instead of focusing exclusively on health and fitness the device is being positioned as a fashion accessory ios compatible smartwatch iphone companion and daily communicator among others however sport a few features including apple pay integration and watchkit development tools that are expected to foster a rich ecosystem of apps later this year

gill rosenberg 31 said last week on facebook that she was no longer updating her page because she was headed to an area without internet who was apparently captured by isis or even serving as a front for isis reported sunday that the was captured by their warriors during fierce battles with kurdish fighters in unspecified areas rosenberg was taken hostage following three suicide attacks on sites where kurdish fighters had barricaded themselves the websites gave no further details regarding the circumstances of the capture nor did they provide any proof of it the reports of rosenberg capture are probably isis propaganda israel general security service told the jerusalem post that there are no further details at this stage until december 8 she wrote it is not clear where she went at this time rosenberg would likely be the first western female to fall into isis captivity holding israeli citizenship would complicate her situation even further which refused to negotiate with isis over their captured nationals thus giving the impression of laissez faire interest israel invests intense concern into the fate of its citizens captured by terrorists if she has indeed been captured or that isis would agree to talk israel chalking her nationality up to canadian alone she would be the second israeli of dual nationality in this position steven sotloff a freelance american journalist who also held israeli citizenship and filed for the jerusalem report from the syrian civil war was captured by isis last year shortly after crossing the syrian border and beheaded by the islamist group this past august an enemy country which israeli citizens are forbidden to enter no matter what has happened to her since joining the kurdish forces whether safe or in isis captivity there is no doubt that upon return to israel she will be arrested and prosecuted as was the case of several israeli arab who joined isis and returned her first serious choice encounter with death canada and experienced a family crisis after her parents divorced in an interview with in 2009 she said that already at the age of 22 she was pursuing a promising career as a pilot of boeing passenger planes but decided to leave everything behind and make aliya in in israel she joined the idf serving as an instructor for kenyan soldiers who came to israel for home front search and rescue training but was hurt during her military training and afterward had money problems she claimed she joined a group of israelis who were accused of setting up a ring to cheat elderly americans and steal their money through a fake lottery scheme according to the indictments filed against them they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars and perhaps even millions from the unknowing pensioners a joint israel police and fbi before apple unveiled the apple watch last september reports indicated the device would come with 10 sensors to track health and fitness data leading some healthcare professionals to find the unveiled apple watch health features disappointing in a new report the wall street journal offers a look at the original apple watch health features that were dropped due to consistency problems with a focus on health and fitness not unusual for apple to experiment with many technologies or shift focus during product development but the watch was especially challenging people familiar with the matter said internally the project became known as a sucking in resources one of these people apple watch originally featured sensors that measured the conductivity of skin allowing the device to detect stress levels and monitoring similar to an electrocardiogram also known as an ekg apple also experimented with ways to detect blood pressure or how much oxygen is in a user blood however a mix of consistency problems and potential oversight caused apple to switch the focus of the device from to a more general product while results varied depending on how tight an apple watch was worn on users wrists additionally if apple decided to use the health data to provide health or behavioral advice the cupertino company would have to seek approval from the food and drug administration and other regulators sources tell the wsj that they could appear in future versions of the device echoing a reuters report from september apple ceo tim cook said the company objective with apple watch is to change the way people live their lives and that people would be surprised by the breadth of what the device can do which includes activity monitoring reminding users to stand up after a certain time period and communication with friends apple is currently asking developers to have their apple watch apps ready by with some developers traveling to apple cupertino headquarters for help with half of those units being the entry apple watch sport and being the apple watch tag

new york city continues to seek ways to cut down on the large number of arrests stemming from marijuana possession instead opting to issue court summonses according to a report 9 in the new york times it was immediately clear what threshold the city will use to determine procession or when the new policy will be implemented the borough district attorney said july the policy change in new york most populous borough makes exceptions for those with a criminal history or who smoke marijuana in public places or near children according to the marijuana arrest research project the brooklyn district attorney office has dismissed 849 marijuana cases since july or about 34 of the 2526 total cases in brooklyn king county brooklyn had 20413 arrests and summonses more than any other county in the state the majority of arrests were of black people the burdens that they pose on the system and the individual are difficult to justify we are pouring money into an endeavor that produces no public safety benefit particularly young people of color the kings county policy change will not result in any changes in the policies and procedures of the nypd new york city police commissioner despite the district attorney decision to stop prosecuting crimes a spokesman for the staten island district attorney said his borough would also enforce the law

reports that islamic state militants in mosul have contracted ebola swirled though iraqi media sources on wednesday world health organization officials said they have confirmed the cases but the organization has reached out to offer assistance a city 250 miles north of baghdad that been under isis control since june the reports however have perpetuated mostly in and kurdish media christy feig who director of communications told mashable a task that could be a challenge given the restrictions that would come with operating in territory who was convinced the cases are ebola told the kurdish media outlet xendan that the militants symptoms were similar to those of the ebola virus ebola symptoms nausea and vomiting diarrhea bleeding and bruising are also similar to those associated with a number of other diseases including malaria lassa fever yellow fever viruses and the marburg virus also most confirmed ebola cases in this recent outbreak have originated in west africa iraq official newspaper al sabaah said the disease arrived in mosul from terrorists who came from several countries and africa very few of them if any at all are believed to have traveled from west africa according to a washington post report others came from morocco libya egypt algeria sudan and somalia none of which reported any ebola cases in 2014 at this point seems highly unlikely it would mark the first time the virus had been detected in an area controlled by isis a group that does embrace science and modern medicine militants affiliated with isis have executed more than a dozen doctors in mosul according to benjamin decker an intelligence analyst with the levantine group a middle geopolitical risk and research consultancy decker who specializes in iraq told mashable he said the lack of medical infrastructure supplies and practitioners in the city suggests that the outbreak could quickly lead to further infection of both isis fighters and residents of mosul

reuters north korean leader kim jong un is in firm control of his government but has hurt his leg a source with access to the secretive north leadership said on thursday playing down speculation over the health and grip on power which usually chronicles kim whereabouts in great detail has not made any mention of his activities since he attended a concert with his wife on 3 and he pulled a tendon the source told reuters on condition of anonymity the source said who has rapidly gained weight since coming to power after his father died of a heart attack in 2011 had been seen walking with a limp since an event with key officials in july which would imply he may have aggravated an earlier injury said the source whose information could not be independently verified said the source who has close ties to pyongyang and beijing an event kim has marked in the past two years with a visit to the pyongyang mausoleum where the bodies of his father and grandfather are interred it could fuel speculation over the state of his health and whether he may have been sidelined in a power struggle experts said the more uncertainty about him and the status of his regime will grow said curtis melvin a researcher at the institute at the johns hopkins school of advanced international studies in washington although this is not the first time he has been missing from public view six months after coming to power state media failed to report on or photograph him for 23 days a scenario they say was reinforced by the unexpected visit on saturday of a delegation to the closing ceremony of the asian games in incheon south korea said andray abrahamian of the choson exchange a ngo running a programme for north koreans in southeast asia kim yo jong is known to have an official role within the ruling party his brother kim jong chol and his estranged are not in the public eye or parliament the first he has not attended since coming to power three years ago kim name has not disappeared from state propaganda the rodong sinmun carried three letters to kim from overseas allies on its front page and has reported on returning athletes from the asian games who thanked the marshal for his support during the competition it is unlikely that they would want to remove him given his unmatchable symbolic value again though everyone is guessing he said

the fbi is reportedly investigating a new audiotape that allegedly captures the shooting of michael brown according to cnn you can hear what sounds like at least 10 shots fired with a significant pause separating the shooting into two segments cnn don lemon said the news network has confirmed the tape authenticity michael brown was shot at least six times according to an autopsy a attorney for the unidentified man who unknowingly captured the shooting while with a friend claimed on cnn that the tape shows that ferguson officer darren wilson had a point of contemplation before firing the final volley of shots talking to a friend on a video chat blumenthal said he heard loud noises and at the time he did even realize the import of what he was hearing until afterwards and it just happened to have captured 12 seconds of what transpired outside of his building she said because it not just the number of gunshots it how they fired and that has a huge relevance on how this case might finally end up speaking on cnn after hearing the tape said there sounds like a pause in it the audio and when you hear that pause it brings some concern the attorney for michael brown family he retweeted a tweet wednesday night from a cnn viewer that said audio recording of shooting just released has been played on cnn by don lemon at least 5 xs very interesting proves alot sic iraq search for illegal weapons on january 20 2005 iraq on june 13 2003 afghanistan on february 27 2014 2005 afghanistan on june 28 2011 iraq on august 15 2004

video messaging app glide on thursday said it has verified the authenticity and timestamp of a recording that a ferguson missouri resident captured as a police officer shot michael brown to death on a residential street the sounds of what appear to be gunshots can be heard in the background cnn video below the user turned over the video to the fbi as evidence forensic audio expert paul ginsberg told cnn he detected six shots followed by four more after a brief pause an autopsy report commissioned by brown family said the unarmed man was shot at least six times a glide representative told the washington post the video is absolutely authentic and our hearts go out to the family of michael brown this incident underscores how technology is changing the landscape of not only journalism but also criminology glide said in a blog post because glide is the only messaging application using streaming video technology each message is simultaneously recorded and transmitted so the exact time can be verified to the second in this case the video in question was created at pm cdt on saturday august 9th

by isaac abrak abuja nov 1 reuters a man claiming to be boko haram leader abubakar shekau said more than 200 girls kidnapped by the group six months ago had been married off to its fighters contradicting nigerian government claims they would soon be freed nigeria military says it killed shekau a year ago and authorities said in september that they had also killed an imposter posting as him in videos in the latest recording it is hard to see the man face as he his filmed from a distance but it is likely to raise grave doubts about whether talks between a boko haram faction and the government in neighboring chad will secure the release of the girls who were kidnapped from a secondary school in chibok northeast nigeria in april we have have married them off and they are all in their husbands houses the man claiming to be shekau says the over 200 chibok girls have converted to islam which they confess is the best religion either their parents accept this and convert too or they can die the majority of the kidnapped girls were christians the man in the video also denied there was a ceasefire and denounced ahmadu who says he represents boko haram in chad who says we are dialoguing or discussing with anybody are you talking to yourselves we do know anybody by the name of danladi if we meet him now we will cut off his head the man in the video says all we are doing is slaughtering people with machetes and shooting people with guns war is what we want he says also that they are holding a white man the only known hostage seized in the northeast is a german teacher kidnapped from a college in the northeastern city of gombe in july by gunmen widely assumed to be linked to boko haram shekau denial of the ceasefire appears supported by the violence since the government announced it two weeks ago it also raises doubts about the actual influence of ahmadu the campaign for an islamic state by boko haram which has killed thousands and whose name means western education is sinful has become by far the biggest menace to the security of africa biggest economy and top oil producer its fighters have attacked targets almost every day for weeks and last week seized control of mubi the home town of nigeria defense chief air chief marshal alex badeh it was badeh who announced the ceasefire they robbed banks burned down houses and hoisted their black flag over the emir palace killing dozens of people and forcing thousands to flee witnesses in mubi said a car bomb thought to have been planted by boko haram killed at least 10 people at a crowded bus stop in gombe on friday morning emergency services said the government has blamed the violence on boko haram allied criminal networks that it can not control there are also thought to be several competing factions within the group writing by tim cocks editing by louise ireland

a small town sits on federal highway just a short drive away from mexico city iguala is plagued by the tragic triangulation between gangsters crooked cops and beleaguered government officials on saturday the burned bodies of 28 people believed to be missing student protesters were found in a mass grave just outside the city center police officers reportedly opened fire on the protesters killing three however officials and students tell very different stories of how the protests ended only to be chased by officers who opened fire whereas officials have said the students commandeered the buses by force resulting in the violence those investigating the mass grave found video showing the police officers arresting and taking away an undisclosed number of students where gangs recently burned four trucks transporting to the ground and the opium trade is still alive and well the area rival one another in both drug sales and acts of been implicated in the deaths of the 28 students by several tipsters who disclosed the location of the bodies including the mayor and chief of security both of whom are wanted for arrest members of guerreros unidos got their start as the hitman division of the beltran leyva organization and are known for extremely violent and aggressive deaths and public displays of beheading victims leader of guerreros unidos ordered the students to be murdered after security chief francisco salgado valladares directly asked for the assistance of el chucky men at the location of the buses thus far authorities have charged 22 police officers with involvement in the crime as well as seven others as many of the bodies have been dismembered and are charred beyond visual recognition

a mysterious explosion that rocked crowded capital managua creating a large crater appears to have been caused by a small meteorite in a sprawling city of million people the impact near the international airport did not cause any known injuries but it did leave a crater measuring 12 metres across and was felt throughout the capital late on saturday which passed very close to earth yesterday and was estimated by astronomers to be about 20 metres big or the size of a house said wilfredo strauss of the seismic institute a small seismic wave when the meteorite hit earth and then another stronger one which is the impact of the he said william martinez said it was not yet clear if the meteorite burned up completely or if it had been blasted into the soil martinez said first lady rosario murillo said managua would be in contact with the us geological service to try to get more information about fascinating in the central american nation one of latin poorest countries and that liquid sand and dust were blown through the air which smelled like something had burned and flights at the airport were not affected at the time of closest approach would be approximately the distance from the centre of earth to the moon or about 40000 kilometres

for vegetarians and animal rights groups and on friday even made it to the front page of the new york times a version of that quotation was uttered by a pope but it was said decades ago by paul vi who died in there is no evidence that francis repeated the words during his public audience on 26 as has been widely reported nor was there was a boy mourning his dead dog which centered on the end times and the transformation of all creation into a and a citing paul in the new testament francis said that is not annihilation of the cosmos and of everything around us but the bringing of all things into the fullness of the report quoted paul vi as telling a disconsolate boy years ago somewhat misleadingly for animals the pope rule it it clear which pope the writer meant however 27 a story in the italian daily corriere della sera by veteran vaticanista gian guido vecchi pushed the headline further pope and pets is open to all and also cited paul remark and that became the story by the way is nowhere in the bible which cited paul as saying that day we will see our animals again in the eternity of while it has francis adding the phrase is open to all further conflating the statements and the chronology it became a hot mess of a story that was also sparking another theological debate by a pope who was known for prompting controversy paradise and pope francis paradise and pope francis along with input from ethicists and theologians it became gospel truth news outlets created photo galleries of popes with cute animals and others used it as a jumping off point to discuss what other religions think about animals and the afterlife at america magazine the rev james martin wrote an essay discussing the theological implications of statements and what level of authority they may have it was all very interesting and illuminating but based on a misunderstanding the patron saint of environmentalism who famously greeted animals as brothers and sisters and almost since the day he was elected in 2013 he has stressed the christian duty to care for creation an affecting image that was often used in connection with these latest reports of his concern for animals the media and the public are so primed for francis to say novel things and disregard staid customs that the story was too good to check out it fit with the pattern comments were also set against statements by his predecessor benedict xvi who insisted that animals did not have souls that apparent contrast fit a common narrative pitting the more conservative benedict against the ostensibly liberal francis but probably not when it comes to animals the times article cited john paul ii as saying in 1990 that animals have souls and are near to god as men but that too was a misquote as media critic dawn eden explained at the website getreligion there should have been warnings signs francis has frowned at the modern tendency to favor pets over people and he has criticized the vast amounts of money spent by wealthy societies on animals even as children go hungry the huge popularity has led to at least one other instance of news reports last year said that francis was sneaking out of the vatican at night to feed the homeless around rome saying the idea never crossed my and that the pope to be a sort of superman a type of star seems offensive to and to offer his real thoughts on pets and paradise

it seems like robots are everywhere these days and now rolling around microsofts silicon valley campus to fight crime and keep everyone safe at least the idea behind a pilot program the company ran last week to test a fleet of five k5 security guard robots k5s weigh 300 pounds and are 5 feet tall they use cameras and sensors to keep track of their surroundings and look for suspcious activity they can license plate numbers and even analyze faces while k5s equipped with weapons and run or get in face anyway they do have onboard alarms and sirens to alert people if something bad is going on and if they spot something that a person should handle they can call a human security guard over the k5s also use laser scanning and gps for navigating weather sensors and of course connectivity and vice president of sales and marketing told mit tech review takes away the monotonous and sometimes dangerous work and leaves the strategic work to law enforcement or private security depending on the but if in trouble you can also use them to call for help they have battery life of about 24 hours and can automatically bring themselves back to their charging stations when low on juice and true that artificial intelligence coordinating an actions and making decisions about where it should go and what it should do next but reaction to the robots seems kind of alarmist microsoft is s howing a rather shocking disregard for the safety of human that and other comments might be meant as but the a5s seem any different from the robot guards south korea piloted in prisons in 2012 or even boston atlas robot which is designed to be used in dangerous situations like natural disaster relief or fire rescues a5s might seem scarier but as eyes and ears that never get tired and can just endlessly putter around a big campus a5s seem like a reasonable solution

the man who scaled the white house fence and was able to run through the front doors made it farther into the building than was previously reported cbs news has learned omar gonzalez ran unobstructed for 70 yards across the front lawn of the white house before entering through the north portico on the way he brushed by a secret service officer with a drawn gun cbs news bill plante reports past the staircase that leads up to the first family residence he was confronted by a female secret service agent who he overpowered and was only brought down by a door leading to the green room a parlor adjacent to the east room of the white house that is used for formal events including bill signings press conferences receptions and ceremonies it was reported that gonzalez only made it through the north doors of the white house which were apparently unlocked before being apprehended by the secret service former secret service director ralph basham told cbs news explaining his understanding of the apprehension basham spoke with current director julia pierson as recently as this weekend just minutes after president obama his daughters and one of their friends boarded the presidential helicopter for a weekend getaway to camp david the presidential retreat in maryland the first lady had traveled there separately it prompted the secret service to erect a second fence about 12 feet further away from the white house than the permanent fence creating second barrier that fence jumpers would have to climb omar gonzalez as he sprinted across the lawn or release guard dogs to detain him was because he appeared unarmed in fact he was found carrying a inch folding knife with a serrated blade and his car reportedly contained 800 rounds of ammunition the washington post reported that it took agents four days to realize a man had fired bullets that struck the white house in 2011 so part of the hearing is to discuss the perimeter at the white house but i think the problems are much deeper seated than that committee member jason chaffetz told cbs news there are other incidents that we might talk about but we also going to reach back during her tenure to review what has happened and not happened house oversight and government reform committee chairman darrell issa told cbs news that it will be very difficult for the american people to trust the agency after the last incident he said

in quite recent news j j abrams has reportedly said at the visual effects society awards 2015 that he may release his extremely anticipated film star wars episode vii the force awakens instead of winter he may move his film down the line for a summer release this is an extremely brave move if true as it puts star wars up against films like avengers 2 age of ultron and the long awaited jurassic world but who would win at the summer box office if it were to happen in my opinion star wars has got the strongest chance at the box office if moved to a summer release but why would he do it all the big films come out in the summer and i mean there no hobbit to compete with in december so why move it down to summer rey fin and shows us what kylo ren ol crossguard will look like with his outer cloak removed i do see that if more of these pictures are leaked we could be seeing what han leia luke c3po etc will be like in the film before seeing a company made trailer which would ruin the surprise disney being the owners of the new star wars franchise have taken j j thoughts into consideration and deep thought which could get the film released a lot earlier than we thought we were going to see it there are some bad things about this though if we do get what we all wish for and we get to see star wars 7 about 6 months before we thought we were going to wo disney be in a panic if they thought that their blockbuster was coming in december would they have ordered toy designs trailers etc for later on in the year perhaps this is just paranoia but disney and j j will have a lot of work to get done if they want their merchandise etc to come alongside star wars in summer the suit deadpool movie news and other awesome

sana yemen an american journalist held for more than a year by al affiliate in yemen was killed during a rescue attempt by united states commandos late friday a senior united states official said luke somers 33 was apparently shot by his captors as the raid unfolded and was badly wounded when the commandos reached him by the time somers was flown to a united states naval ship in the region he had died from his injuries the official said saturday which took place in the southern yemeni province of shabwa when asked about the operation at a security conference in bahrain lloyd austin iii the head of united states central command declined to comment 33 a kidnapped american group in yemen threatens to kill american journalist by end of this weekdec 4 2014 lucy somers told the associated press on saturday that she had been notified by the fbi of her death ask that all of family members be allowed to mourn in she said a freelance journalist was abducted in the yemeni capital sana in september last month united states commandos and yemeni counterterrorism troops made an unsuccessful attempt to rescue him in a remote yemeni province al qaeda in the arabian peninsula the yemeni extremist group that was holding somers threatened to kill him by the end of the week if its demands were not met in the video a leader of the group spoke of the november raid and warned the united states not to carry out any similar operations including citizens of britain turkey and south africa

security forces investigating the role of municipal police in clashes in this southern city a week ago found a mass grave on the edge of town raising fears the pits might hold 43 students missing since the violence that also resulted in six shooting deaths the father of one of the missing students told the associated press that a delegation of family and school representatives would come to iguala on sunday to get information about developments in the case from authorities but until they inform us there is said lopez whose son giovani been seen since the violence last weekend a group of students and relatives of the missing young people said they planned to march sunday from aytozinapa normal school to the state capital of chilpancingo to demand information in the case and he declined to speculate about whether the dead were the missing students blanco said officials said the federal attorney office and the national human rights commission had sent teams of experts to aid state authorities in identifying the remains marines and federal and state police on saturday cordoned off the area where the grave site was found in the poor pueblo viejo district of iguala which is about 120 miles 200 kilometres south of mexico city adding to the 22 iguala city police officers detained after a police confrontation with student protesters last weekend set off a series of violent incidents in the city adding that some of them had given key clues leading to the discovery of the mass grave killing three youths and wounding a few hours later unidentified masked gunmen shot at two taxis and a bus carrying a soccer team on the main highway killing two people on the bus and one in a taxi a southern state where poverty feeds social unrest and drug gangs clash over territory like many other schools in teachers system is known for militant and radical protests that often involve hijacking buses and delivery trucks two students from aytozinapa died in a clash with police on the highway that leads to the pacific coast resort of acapulco students had allegedly hijacked buses and blocked the road to press demands for more funding and assured jobs after graduation two state police officers were charged in the shootings students apparently set fire to pumps at a gas station on the highway when federal and state police moved in to quell the protest and a gas station employee later died of burns suffered in the attack

the man who jumped the white house fence this month and sprinted through the front door made it much farther into the building than previously known overpowering one secret service officer and running through much of the main floor according to three people familiar with the incident said a secret service official who spoke on the condition of anonymity omar gonzalez was about to burst through officers are trained that upon learning of an intruder on the grounds often through the alarm boxes posted around the property they must immediately lock the front door gonzalez who was carrying a knife dashed past the stairway leading a up to the first living quarters he then ran into the east room an ornate space often used for receptions or presidential addresses a parlor overlooking the south lawn with artwork and antique furniture according to three people familiar with the incident but most individuals are tackled by secret services officers guarding the complex before getting even a third of the way across the lawn gonzalez is the first person known to have jumped the fence and made it inside the executive mansion and on friday she briefed president obama on her plans to shore up security including new revelations published over the weekend by the washington post about the failure to identify and properly investigate a 2011 shooting attack on the white house chairman of a house oversight subcommittee on homeland security whose office is near the front door complained they were noisy a secret service official told the post that the office was concerned the boxes were frequently malfunctioning and unnecessarily sounding off which officers call are key pieces of the system according to former agents and officials if they spot an intruder officers are trained to hit the large red button on the nearest box sending an alert to every post on the complex about the location of an incursion and piping sound from that location to other boxes around the property the fact that crash boxes were muted to avoid being is not due to a lack of resources or an insufficient number of checkpoints or chaffetz said chaffetz said must examine what message is being sent to the men and women who protect the president when their leader sacrifices security to appease superficial concerns of white house a plainclothes surveillance team was on duty that night outside the fence meant to spot jumpers and give early warning before they made it over when that team notice gonzalez there was an officer in a guard booth on the north lawn when that officer reach gonzales there was supposed to be an attack dog a specialized swat team and a guard at the front door all at the ready a decision now under review some people familiar with the incident say the handler likely felt he could not release the dog because so many officers were in pursuit of gonzalez and the dog may have attacked them instead the secret service has added an additional layer of temporary fencing while the agency reviews its procedures

intended targets the department of defense estimated 80 percent but not all of them did officials said that much of the aid had been because it was dropped from 15000 feet without parachutes and kim jong un north korea young dictator sits at the top of a nation that for decades has enshrined the ruling kim dynasty as demigods the personality cult that surrounds the hermit kingdom leadership is one of the strange realities of this pariah state spawning eerie totalitarian spectacles and the most vigorous displays of clapping the world has ever seen north korean authorities issued a directive in 2011 when kim jong un came to power after the death of his father kim jong il to reject birth certificates of newborns named kim jong un and to revise the official documentation and identity cards of those who still had that name read the document which was revealed by the kbs tv station on tuesday it said its authenticity can not be independently confirmed if true should not come as a surprise both kim father and grandfather kim il sung instituted the same vanity project insisting on being the first and last holders of their names the practice has echoes in the deep history of east asian kingdoms but like much else in north korea really ought not have a place in the 21st century

adding to apple ios 8 launch troubles a report on monday claims the operating system reset all settings feature for hardware wiping user preferences also deletes data stored in icloud drive the issue presents itself when iphone and ipad users attempt to reset preferences via the device settings general reset reset all settings option the feature allows users to troubleshoot possible ios issues by reverting all system settings back to factory baselines and subsequently icloud drive is not yet available for consumer download aside from apple public beta testing program the effects on consumers are however with a large number of untrained public beta participants opting in to the service with ios 8 the problem could become serious one ipad user performed the reset and found his local iwork documents deleted which consequently wiped those same documents from the cloud when the tablet synced to icloud it appears only data from apps connected to icloud drive are affected by the bug though not all users are seeing the issue play out as described files are being delete upon syncing with icloud while other data remains untouched it is suggested that users back up icloud drive documents to a local computer prior to performing the reset all settings operation syncing and collaboration the system allows seamless file transport and storage across ios os x and windows while enabling advanced features like document editing asset tagging and data management bringing the company the feature has already rolled out to beta testers as well as the beta website which now supports access and editing of stored documents

while laptop sales continue to drop apple macbook air has managed to remain popular and perform well this year apple is set to launch a macbook air which could just be apple biggest product in 2015 the new laptop from apple has just been confirmed by the latest report from mark gurman of 9to5mac apple has made a number of changes in the macbook air removing and redesigning what users know and love about the machine magsafe connectors and sd card slots said gurman which allows it to keep a slightly bigger display the bezels around the display have also been reduced giving the front part of the machine a brand new look namely the headphone jack and a usb port this means that fans of the machine will have to do away with the thunderbolt connection and the magsafe charger the specs of the new usb indicate that the can support driving displays and device charging faster and more capable than the standard usb and ports on existing computers added gurman

there a story currently making the rounds about an australian man who upon returning from a trip to bali discovered that a spider burrowed under his skin and traveled up to his chest freaky yes but it also not plausible arachnophobes you do not have to worry about charlotte weaving her web beneath your flesh the supposed story goes like this dylan thomas a man not the dead poet was on vacation in bali and woke up one morning to discover a red trail of irritation running from his navel to his chest a trail that continued to grow longer throughout the day after initially being sent home with antihistamines he returned to the medical center where doctors discovered a tiny tropical spider beneath his skin supposedly they removed the creature through an incision and placed it in a specimen jar according to thomas his doctors speculated that it had entered his skin through an appendectomy scar and just kept moving up his body thomas told various news outlets that he believes the spider was there for three days nope and a lot of arachnologists saying simply no that did happen thomas may have been told that a spider invaded his flesh but the arachnologists we spoke to about this story sincerely doubt that one actually did unusual and likely not possible christopher buddle associate professor at mcgill university department of natural resource sciences told us in an email simply put it is not plausible and i can think of no valid reason why a spider might beneath skin through a scar the claim that it was and moving up through the scar tissue defies logic and defies what we know about the biology of spiders i am also sceptical because the the spider itself is not presented schlinger curator of arachnology emeritus at the california academy of sciences said he could comment on this particular incident but was similarly skeptical i n general this is impossible and there is no reason that a spider would do that he wrote but we should wait to hear if more information comes out about the specimen buddle told us other arthropods some insects could be with something like perhaps but certainly not a spider head of the department of biological sciences at macquarie university in new south wales does fully exclude the possibility that this could be a spider though she writes i have never heard of any spider to crawl or exist under the skin or integument of any other creature there are no parasites amongst spiders but she also suspects it may be a different animal she told us my initial reaction is that this is a mite also rather than a spider and mites are renown ed for this type of behaviour such as in scabies let see what the identification brings taken by lip kee cc

amazon has warehouses hundreds of them miles of them it has lockers and shipping containers but it never had a true physical retail store at least not until now the wall street journal is reporting that amazon plans to open its first physical store and that it will be located in midtown manhattan right in the heart of new york city it be located on 34th street right between the flagship macy store and the empire state building the store will reportedly be just an extension of what amazon already does in its physical spaces amazon will accept returns at the location and will use it as a particularly tuned for delivery of products in new york you also be able to pick up online orders at the store meaning you be able to buy online and get items even faster amazon may also use the store to show off its kindle and fire products which seems like a spectacularly obvious thing to do but is evidently still only being considered there potential to do much more amazon been building to this the company launched a tool for identifying products a for buying them and much more that suggests it could quickly build a physical retail space it been rumored for years that amazon would do this and even now amazon tells the journal that this is just an experiment and could be the beginning of an entirely new branch of competition between amazon and its biggest competitors

with a story of its own with the fat figure playing a key role in the headline school student scores 72m playing the stock the real number is zero the baby faced boys who dress in suits with tie clips excited by this whole trading thing and i said hey let me get on board i heard about this article coming out and mohammed invited me and i met jessica from queens and you go to this elite public high morals are that if i lie about it and own up to it then they can no longer trust me they knew it was false and they basically wanted to kill me and i spoken to them since people will be mad about it figure the story is already coming unglued as the commenters on new site hammer the reporter for even thinking this was possible new york has now altered its headline to back away from the 72 million cnn north korean leader kim jong un who recently disappeared from public view for about six weeks had a cyst removed from his right ankle a lawmaker told cnn between may and june that cyst may have caused muscle or nerve damage and prompted him to have ankle surgery between september and october lawmaker lee said lawmakers were told that european experts handled the surgery for tarsal tunnel syndrome the syndrome is caused by compression at the ankle known to cause pain during standing and walking south korean lawmakers were told but the cyst could recur due to his obesity and heavy schedule kim seemed to reappear october 14 when north korean state media published the first photos of him in which the beaming kim held a cane in his left hand as he gave field guidance at a newly built residential district according to nk news a website devoted to analyzing north korea as a after the execution of kim uncle jang song thaek north korea executed 10 party officials by firing squad for charges ranging from corruption to women issues to the viewing of a south korean soap opera intelligence officials also told lawmakers that senior military officials were demoted for poor accuracy in artillery drills kim was seen limping prompting theories he was suffering everything from weight gain to gout his sudden disappearance took a concerning turn earlier this month when he did appear at events to mark the 65th anniversary of the worker party of north korea north korea has released several photos of kim but has yet to release video the former personal doctor to kim grandfather kim il sung kim inherited a number of health issues including psychological problems and a history of obesity she said both kim il sung and kim father kim jong il suffered from diabetes heart problems and stress she said kim face appeared to have swollen due to painkillers she also speculated that he has been receiving hormone shots to make him look more like his grandfather the founder of north korea madison park and hamdi alkhshali contributed to this report

after a disastrous ios rollout and a ton of publicity surrounding bendgate saying that apple had a bad week is an understatement things are looking much better this week as macrumors reports on a particularly nasty ios 8 bug which could potentially erase the iwork documents stored in your icloud drive the option to reset all settings found under settings general reset in ios 8 also deletes documents from the icloud drive permanently which normally resets settings to factory defaults clearly states that no data or media will be deleted however after some users on macrumors forum complained about the bug macrumors tested the option out and indeed all the iwork documents stored in icloud drive both on the iphone and on were gone after icloud synced with a mac running os x yosemite the documents were deleted from the mac as well some of the documents including preview and textedit files were untouched but all iwork files seem to be affected or via time machine but nothing is certain at this point and apple still has publicly acknowledged the bug for now ios 8 users who have icloud drive enabled should probably avoid using the reset all settings option

apple is shifting its retail strategy for the apple watch to deliver a more personalized shopping experience according to the wall street journal the report claims that apple stores will accept reservations for customers to try on the apple watch and corroborates that apple is training its retail employees to help customers choose an apple watch model that suits them best citing sources familiar with the matter adds that the apple watch edition will have gold which an analysis over the weekend revealed is because apple mixes the metal with ceramic particles apple is also said to have studied a platinum apple watch but the model is unlikely to be announced monday the company has refined the luxury features making the gold in the edition model according to people familiar with the matter reports the wall street journal it also has studied platinum watch casings although the company expected to announce that on monday they said apple ceo tim cook during a visit to the covent garden apple store in london last month told retail employees that apple has never sold anything as a company that people could try on before the chief executive added that tweaking the experience in the store will likely be a requirement when the device launches in april it also appears likely that the apple watch will be exclusive to apple stores immediately following the product launch although for how long remains unknown tag march 2015 event

attacks against american consumers as they wait in line for stores to open on november 28th the day known as black friday relatively unknown group of islamic militants and fanatics that originated in bhakkar pakistan as the central leadership of al qaeda disintegrated under the pressures of military operations in afghanistan and drone strikes conducted around the world the group has since branched out and begun aggressively recruiting throughout the middle east africa and europe within the last year the group has come under increased scrutiny by both the cia and the department of homeland security as they have begun actively recruiting on american soil director of the department of homeland security has referred to bhakkar fatwa as the number one growing problem on the domestic terrorism front in america their presence is felt in many mosques and islamic centers across the country always quietly and out of sight and previously without any violent operations officials at both the cia and homeland security think that may be about to change agent in charge of monitoring bhakkar american operation detailed the agencies recent findings with both the cia and the nsa we were able to access conversations and communications between members of bhakkar domestic organization and their leadership in pakistan which indicate that several attacks are planned against american citizens at retail operations on the 28th of said phillips instructions sent from pakistan detailed a broad plan of attacks using both firearms and homemade explosives against large crowds gathered outside of stores waiting for the sales that have become the hallmark of the day the leadership of bhakkar fatwa views the american religion as one worshiping money and possessions they commanded these attacks as being against the that the americans stated phillips have detained three individuals who were in active communication with pakistani leadership regarding these planned terror attacks all three are undergoing interrogation as we speak so that we may hopefully determine the scope and extent of attacks that have been planned the names of those detained will not be immediately released they have been deemed enemy combatants and releasing their identities could impact our operational ability at this point everything conceivable is being done to unmask and deal with this new phillips advised at this juncture we are unsure as to how great the threat from these attacks is going to be we are working as quickly as we can to resolve this situations but this terrorist group is savvy they utilize a small closed cell structure and we may not be able to identify all of them in time i urge all americans to strongly consider whether the sales are worth the risk and if you do go out take particular caution while waiting in line for the store to open intelligence points to the time spent waiting outside of the store as the time of greatest vulnerability i am sure we will resolve this issue but i still recommend taking adequate

investment firm piper jaffray issued a report on monday breaking down expected apple watch average selling prices saying an aggregate of consumers will likely spend closer to 550 on the device considering case and internal storage options analyst gene munster anticipates combined apple watch asps to fall closer to 550 or 575 to 600 including additional bands apple watch and apple watch edition each series including two display sizes and a variety of strap choices the aluminum and glass version widely thought to be the least expensive model munster expects an asp of 450 after factoring in configuration alternatives like case and internal storage options which also features a more expensive sapphire glass cover is expected to start at 499 to 549 again depending on customizable features munster sees an overall asp at around 650 for the watch series the analyst forecasts base model apple watch edition devices to start at 4999 but classifies segment asp closer to 7500 after adding in straps made from precious metals which come in at 35 munster sees elastomer apple watch straps to start in a similar 29 to 35 range while leather bands could be priced between 49 to 59 pricing for metal bands like the link bracelet and milanese loop are more difficult to determine but the analyst believes steel versions will come in at 99 while gold bands could be priced into the thousands of dollars 35 percent leather 10 percent steel and about 5000 total gold bands are sold the average band asp could be around 50 munster writes equating to a 575 asp if every watch customer purchases an extra strap it would tack on 50 bringing asp up to 600 while the apple watch will take another 45 percent that leaves very little room for apple watch edition but munster believes apple might sell roughly 10000 units this year in an interesting comparison the firm calculates that apple watch edition business could equate to about two percent of luxury watchmaker rolex which moves between 600000 to 750000 units each year munster expects apple to reveal a better sense of device pricing at its march 9 event as well as highlight special features to drum up consumer interest ahead of release

with violent itching severe swelling of the throat and a drastic drop in blood pressure the man who was known to have allergies quickly injected a degree but his health continued to deteriorate but the medical staff could not identify the cause of the allergic reaction in the time and no treatments or conventional medications seemed to work ramos was pronounced dead a little over an hour after arriving at the hospital less than 24 hours before his death less than 24 hours before his death and this because of an allergic reaction to seafood because the only things he had swallowed before his also some antibiotic resistance genes that had prevented the white blood cells of ramos to save his life contact with fish or seafood during the preparation explained rafael it is that when we tested the tomato itself we noticed that it contained certain allergens commonly found in seafood we did a lot of different analyzes and they all confirmed that the tomato was indeed the source of allergens online retail giant amzn plans to open its first store according to people familiar with the plans set to open in time for the season on busy 34th street would mark an experiment by amazon to connect with customers in the physical world amazon has built its business on competitive pricing and fast shipping until now though it compete with the immediacy of a traditional store across from the empire state building in midtown would function as a with limited inventory for delivery within new york product returns and exchanges and pickups of online orders said matt nemer a wells fargo analyst delivery ordering online and picking up in store are ideas that are really catching on amazon needs to be at the center of particularly its devices like the kindle fire smartphone or fire tv box according to people familiar with the thinking amazon has largely avoided some costs associated with retailing including leases paying employees and managing inventory in hundreds of stores those expenses could imperil the already thin profit margins including the size length of the lease or amount of inventory that would be housed there people familiar with the matter cautioned that plans could change and that the store is an experiment and could be deemed unsuccessful however the new york location could presage a rollout to other cities according to the people familiar with the thinking even scouting locations in its hometown seattle about two years ago before scrapping the idea said another person familiar with the effort amazon once sold kindles in stores and target outlets but those retailers pulled the devices from shelves two years ago in an apparent nod to growing power in retailing owned by vornado realty trust once housed an department store and now has mango and express stores at street level there are two loading docks at the back of the building which last year attracted million visitors to its observatory it is a block east of herald square where flagship store draws more than 20 million annual visitors according to the 34th street partnership a district said chase welles executive vice president at scg retail a service company when it was populated by retailers since then the district and area companies have spent about 2 billion on upgrades to the neighborhood and individual properties according to the 34th street partnership global and national retailers such as zara uniqlo and vince camuto have opened stores on the street got very high ceilings it is got big open floor plates and the type of property that a lot of the creative class favor he said even scouting locations in its hometown seattle about two years ago before scrapping the idea bloomberg home depot and offer the service others employ delivery services such as google ebay or startup deliv to fetch orders from stores rather than warehouses and bring them to customers including shops and locations run by subsidiaries last november appeared in malls selling and tablets from vending machines its zappos unit has a store near its kentucky distribution center and once operated a few outlets in its hometown las vegas and its quidsi unit runs a cosmetics store in manhasset to accommodate deliveries and returns the lockers offer delivery however the lockers have been a popular option and amazon has expanded them to a number of cities including overseas after initially just offering them in seattle allowing customers to order ebay goods online and pick them up in its argos stores said one person familiar with thinking by end argos expects to provide the service at 650 stores from 65000 ebay sellers including clothier bonobos eyeglasses purveyor warby parker and subscription service birchbox said chief executive andy dunn the stores offer limited inventory so customers can determine their size and choose styles and patterns the merchandise is then shipped to their home from a warehouse or can be collected later

the man known as jihadi john photo reuters the masked man with a british accent who has beheaded several hostages held by the islamic state and who taunts audiences in videos circulated widely online according to friends and others familiar with his case is mohammed emwazi a briton from a family who grew up in west london and graduated from college with a degree in computer programming he is believed to have travelled to syria around 2012 and to have later joined the islamic state the group whose barbarity he has come to symbolise said one of emwazi close friends who identified him in an interview with the washington post photo ap a moniker given to him by some of the hostages he once held asim qureshi research director at the rights group cage said after watching one of the videos this is making me feel fairly certain that this is the same person including voice analysis and interviews with former hostages to try to identify jihadi john the director of the fbi said in september only a month after the briton was seen in a video killing american journalist james foley that officials believed they had succeeded the identity of jihadi john has remained shrouded in secrecy since foley killing he has appeared in a series of videos documenting the gruesome killings of other hostages including four other westerners some of whom he personally beheaded he is dressed in all black a balaclava covering all but his eyes and the ridge of his nose he wears a holster under his left arm citing legal advice in his appears to have left little trail on social media or elsewhere online those who knew him say he was polite and had a penchant for wearing stylish clothes while adhering to the tenets of his islamic faith he had a beard and was mindful of making eye contact with women friends said who spoke on the condition of anonymity because of the sensitivity of the investigation believe that emwazi started to radicalise after a planned safari in tanzania following his graduation from the university of westminster abu talib never made it on the trip once they landed in dar es salaam in may 2009 they were detained by police and held overnight it unclear whether the reason for the detention was made clear to the three but they were eventually deported where he claimed that an officer from mi5 britain domestic security agency accused him of trying to reach somalia where the militant group operates in the southern part of the country according to that he sent to qureshi and that were provided to the post which is allied with a british newspaper which identified emwazi as muhammad ibn muazzam where he met with qureshi in the fall of 2009 to discuss what had happened mohammed was quite incensed by his treatment that he had been very unfairly treated qureshi said emwazi decided to move to his birthplace kuwait where he landed a job working for a computer company according to the he wrote to qureshi he came back to london twice the second time to finalise his wedding plans to a woman in kuwait however counterterrorism officials in britain detained him again this time fingerprinting him and searching his belongings when he tried to fly back to kuwait the next day he was prevented from doing so he wrote in a june 2010 to qureshi but now i feel like a prisoner only not in a cage in london a person imprisoned controlled by security service men stopping me from living my new life in my birthplace country kuwait when a court in new york sentenced aafia siddiqui an operative convicted for the attempted murder of us personnel in afghanistan emwazi expressed sympathy for her saying he had heard the upsetting news regarding our sister this should only keep us firmer towards fighting for freedom and justice qureshi said he last heard from emwazi in january 2012 when emwazi sent him an seeking advice qureshi said in the end he felt actions were taken to criminalise him and he had no way to do something against these actions the friend said he was gone one of the friends said he at some stage reached the point where he was really just trying to find another way to get out emwazi contacted his family and at least one of his friends it unclear what he told them about his activities there syria in the hostages nicknamed the facility the box emwazi was joined by two other men with british accents including one who was dubbed george a former hostage said emwazi participated in the waterboarding of four western hostages they said was quiet and intelligent he was the most deliberate a former hostage said the hostages were moved to a prison in the syrian city of raqqa the islamic state de facto capital where they were visited often by the trio they appeared to have taken on more powerful roles within the islamic state qureshi said he sent an to emwazi he wrote inshallah god willing it will be good to catch up

if you jonesing for an apple watch you probably want to do a lot with it but what if you headed out to a party and would rather not risk staring at a dead screen when you wondering how late it is do worry you covered the new york times understands that the watch has an unannounced power reserve option that limits the device to telling time while it not a completely unique feature other watches do similar things it definitely helpful and it a departure for apple whose mobile devices have had these kinds of extreme modes until now tim cook and crew are likely to make a big deal of power reserve at apple march 9th event assuming it shows up but it could be one of the watch most important features

on december 17 a site called published a piece under the sensational headline nenad babici babici is the only source the article uses for the story the london daily mail the new york daily news courier mail newser cosmopolitan uk and several others none have performed any to confirm the original reporting one newspaper though added details to the story that were never reported such a culturally incendiary story should have resulted in local politicians and jumping in front of a camera and copious of the front entrance none of this is present the only source referenced at all in the story is babici and his claim that it happened but notably he is not quoted as saying it happened he is paraphrased the remainder of the article does include a direct quote from him but the quote refer to the incident it instead pushes what is likely a top agenda of his ministry which is that teenage sexual activity can have other health consequences and that curbing teen sex is the responsibility of both the parent and the school and after some time it turned out that seven schoolgirls got pregnant on it but also educational institutions toward the education of children various diseases miscarriages and premature births we have 15 percent of miscarriages and between 5 to 10 percent premature he said according to the clinical center of the university in sarajevo 31 minors gave birth four of them are 15 years old ten are 16 years old and 17 are 17 years old then sarajevo have a teen pregnancy problem unless the rate of teen pregnancies that are aborted is stratospheric this story claims the girls were visiting sarajevo from small town in bosnia and called banja luka it is not at all clear as to what population that is drawn from how likely is the claim except for the short window prior to ovulation during which the study estimates the odds at 25 percent so either the seven children were ovulating at the same time and had about four encounters each or they each had closer to 20 encounters over the five days from the incident itself to the manner of the coverage to a media searching for a scoop this is where we are expected to either get to work debunking the article or to stay clear so how did our brethren respond i mentioned that the original article has been linked with confirmation of the original reporting by such mainstream newspapers magazines and websites as the new york post the london daily mail the new york daily news the australian courier mail newser cosmopolitan uk and perhaps representing the worst offense of the bunch the daily mail added details to the story that were never reported

kansas city mo kansas city health officials said a man held in isolation at a local hospital over the weekend was not infected with the ebola virus officials hope to sooth nerves as fears about the deadly virus spread across the country even though the virus itself has not kansas city health department director rex archer told reporters on monday he said the man who had recently traveled to nigeria did not possess the symptom profile for the deadly virus beyond a high fever and had not been in direct contact with anyone who had the disease during his travels archer said because the feared symptoms never materialized as fears of the virus have built while an american fights for his life against it in dallas president barack obama urged calm and outlined several steps the administration is taking to contain the virus in africa and fight it there the president said know what has to be done and we have the medical infrastructure to do kansas senator jerry moran sent a letter to the cdc director urging greater screening at ports of entry including airports president obama said such steps are under consideration obama said of these things make me confident that here in the united states the chances of an an epidemic are extraordinarily

the united states appears to now be flying unarmed surveillance drones over the is stronghold of raqqa syria the pictures thus far suggest that the drone being used is the reaper and the aircraft does not appear to be carrying any missiles as such the available evidence indicates that the drone is being used for surveillance purposes rather than in a type mission the drone has been circling over the city for three hours if the reports are true this would suggest that the air environment over raqqa is permissive drones are visible on radar and easy to shoot down with air defense systems it does not necessarily signal the imminent use of force against is positions in syria there is no information about where the drones are based however information allows for some informed guesses
